description:
Counter Attendant
Duties:- Greet customers and provide excellent customer service- Take customer orders and accurately enter them into the POS system- Prepare and serve food items according to established recipes and procedures- Handle cash transactions and provide accurate change to customers- Maintain a clean and organized work area, including restocking supplies as needed- Follow all food safety and sanitation guidelines- Assist with kitchen duties as needed, such as food preparation and dishwashing
Experience:- Previous experience in food handling, food preparation, or food service is preferred- Cash handling experience is a plus- Basic math skills for cash handling and order processing- Familiarity with POS systems and cashiering procedures- Strong time management skills to ensure efficient service during peak hours- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail- Excellent customer service skills to ensure customer satisfaction
If you are looking for a dynamic role in the food service industry, this position may be perfect for you. Join our team as a Counter Attendant and contribute to creating a positive dining experience for our customers. Apply now!
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Internship / Co-op
Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour
Expected hours: No more than 40 per week
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule

 Monday to Friday
 Morning shift

 Tips

descriptionHTML:
Counter Attendant

Duties:
- Greet customers and provide excellent customer service
- Take customer orders and accurately enter them into the POS system
- Prepare and serve food items according to established recipes and procedures
- Handle cash transactions and provide accurate change to customers
- Maintain a clean and organized work area, including restocking supplies as needed
- Follow all food safety and sanitation guidelines
- Assist with kitchen duties as needed, such as food preparation and dishwashing

Experience:
- Previous experience in food handling, food preparation, or food service is preferred
- Cash handling experience is a plus
- Basic math skills for cash handling and order processing
- Familiarity with POS systems and cashiering procedures
- Strong time management skills to ensure efficient service during peak hours
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail
- Excellent customer service skills to ensure customer satisfaction

If you are looking for a dynamic role in the food service industry, this position may be perfect for you. Join our team as a Counter Attendant and contribute to creating a positive dining experience for our customers. Apply now!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Internship / Co-op

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • Flexible schedule

Flexible Language Requirement:

  • French not required

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Morning shift
  • Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

  • Tips

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities. Setting the bar in innovation of fabrics and functional designs, lululemon works with yogis and athletes in local communities around the world for continuous research and product feedback. ​

From our roots in Vancouver, Canada, lululemon has grown across the globe and through new channels to serve guests worldwide. Our teams are focused on creating authentic connections, whether in stores with one of our educators, online with a digital educator, or in a community with one of our lululemon ambassadors.

We are a purpose-driven brand, and our values guide us in all that we do—from our business strategy and innovation, to how we connect and build our strong culture.

Impact is an essential part of our culture and underpins our business strategy. Guided by our Impact Agenda, we approach this work holistically through three pillars that address the interconnection of our products, people, the communities we serve, and the planet​.
description:
Close date: March 17, 2024 at 11:59pm PST* *Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 

 who we are 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. 

 We owe our success to our innovative product, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 We’re looking for you. Join us . 

 IDEA Global Internship Program 

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities. 

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our [1] Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. 

 about this team 

 The Associate Project Manager will be part of team Technology Strategy and Operations reporting to the Manager, Technology Business Operations. The Strategy & Operations team is responsible for strategy and planning, portfolio management, labour governance, engagement and communications, and business operations for technology. 

 a day in the life 
All our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include: 

 
 
 Supporting current strategies and portfolios of work 
 Working with cross-functional partners to gain alignment on strategic projects 
 Supporting in the day-to-day management of building out solutions for key projects and/or programs 
 Participating in several meetings and conversations pertaining to key areas of your work 
 Understand and apply project management standards & best practices 
 Complete tasks assigned by Project/Program Managers or Technology Managers supporting initiation, planning, scheduling, coordinating, and reporting for 1 or 2 tracks of an active initiative 
 Collaborate with the vendors and various stakeholders of the initiative, as applicable, and effectively communicate relevant data to and from said stakeholders 
 Set up and administer document repository sites, manage where and how to document processes within role’s scope of responsibility 
 nice to haves 

 
 
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience CS/CIS, finance, business administration, or other related field 
 Experience working with or in a technology organization, specifically driving communication and delivery strategies from either an agile or project level 
 Well versed in all Microsoft Office tools with skillset in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint 
 Experience creating deliverables (in excel or PowerPoint) for communication 
 Proven success with task ownership and efficiency in communication & collaboration 
 must haves 

 
 
 Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life. 
 Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results. 
 Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same. 
 Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take yourself too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 
lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300-60,300 annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week. 
References 

 Visible links 
1. http://chrome-extension//efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https://pnimages.lululemon.com/content/dam/lululemon/www-images/Footer/Sustainability/lululemon_ImpactAgenda_October202023.pdf

who we are 
lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 Close date: March 17, 2024 at 11:59pm PST* 

 
 
 Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 
 IDEA Global Internship Program 

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities. 

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. 

 about this team:
 Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) is responsible for planning and managing lululemon’s overall financial performance. We are an amazing team of passionate, active and dedicated leaders who are counted on as a key business partner in strategic and operational decisions. We provide a tremendous opportunity to learn about the various operations within lululemon, working often in cross-functional teams on a variety of projects. You will be able to add value immediately, see the big picture, and develop a business and finance skill set that you can leverage in your future roles within the organization. We are a stand for high quality work, driving high quality results and living a high-quality life 

 A day in the life 

 Reporting into the Director, Global Business, the Financial Analyst Intern is responsible for researching, analyzing and presenting a series of project-based FP&A deliverables. Scope of project work may include, but not limited to: 

 
 
 Assist in transition of existing performance reporting to interactive PBI dashboards. 
 Re-imagine and optimize dashboard reporting through Power BI. 
 Partner with the BI (Business Intelligence) team and assist in UAT of BI enhancements. 
 Assist in project management efforts on large scale, long-term projects through effective stakeholder engagement. 
 Assist in weekly/quarterly performance reporting, presentations and dashboards in MS Excel and Power BI. 
 Assist with general business process documentation, analytics, and improvement (standard operating procedures (SOPs), optimize process flows). 
 The intern will have the opportunity to learn about the diverse roles and responsibilities available in FP&A at lululemon, including Retail Planning, Sales Forecasting, SG&A management, Store Development, Ecommerce, Product and Corporate FP&A functions. The intern will also have the opportunity to work directly with and present back to key business partners (Brand, Supply Chain, Digital, Product, Operations, etc). 

 nice to haves:
 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Commerce, Business, Engineering, Statistics, Data Analytics or a related field. 
 MBA, CFA or CPA is an asset. 
 Expert knowledge of Power BI is preferred - Building reports, writing DAX queries, experience with handling large data exports from BI sources to be manipulated and summarized in MS Excel and in PBI dashboards. 
 Hyperion, Oracle EPM or large financial planning software knowledge is a plus. 
 Demonstrate strong communication skills - Can present to functional teams and management. 
 Can distill and summarize complicated information in a simple and concise way and present it clearly. 
 Able to work with limited direction, can understand and link strategy to the underlying drivers of the business. 
 Extremely organized, thorough and takes pride in quality; strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
 must haves:
 
 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 

 lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300-$60,300 maximum annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement:
 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week. 

 NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. 

 about this team:
 We are self-described "legal outliers." Our vision is to inspire and educate, provide value from beginning to end and create an environment where work enriches life, and life enriches work. We believe in "the sweat life" - sweat, relationships and personal development - and we live it every day. 

 a day in the life 

 
 
 All of our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities for the legal department intern include: 
 Researching legal issues impacting business strategy. 
 Drafting transactional documents. 
 Attending client meetings and product reviews. 
 Collaborating with internal teams on cross-group projects. 
 qualifications:
 Anyone who is currently enrolled in Law School who will have completed their first year by May 2024 

 nice to haves:
 
 
 Excellent analytical ability and legal drafting skills. 
 Excellent oral and written communications skills and the ability to communicate effectively across many diverse internal groups, teams, and divisions. 
 A demonstrated ability to work efficiently, meet deadlines, and manage multi-dimensional projects in a fast-paced environment. 
 Ability to research and learn new concepts and legal issues quickly to facilitate problem-solving. 
 must haves:
 
 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 

 lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300-$60,300 maximum annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement:
 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week. 

 NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.

positionName: IDEA Global Internship Program: Compliance Legal Coordinator Intern (Vancouver, Canada)

companyInfo/companyDescription:
lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities. Setting the bar in innovation of fabrics and functional designs, lululemon works with yogis and athletes in local communities around the world for continuous research and product feedback. ​

From our roots in Vancouver, Canada, lululemon has grown across the globe and through new channels to serve guests worldwide. Our teams are focused on creating authentic connections, whether in stores with one of our educators, online with a digital educator, or in a community with one of our lululemon ambassadors.

We are a purpose-driven brand, and our values guide us in all that we do—from our business strategy and innovation, to how we connect and build our strong culture.

Impact is an essential part of our culture and underpins our business strategy. Guided by our Impact Agenda, we approach this work holistically through three pillars that address the interconnection of our products, people, the communities we serve, and the planet​.
description:
Close date: March 17, 2024 at 11:59pm PST* 

 
 
 Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 
 Who we are 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. 

 We owe our success to our innovative product, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 We’re looking for you. Join us . 

 IDEA Global Internship Program 

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities. 

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our [1] Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. 

 About this team 

 The Merchandise team lives and breathes all things product! We collectively work together towards getting the right product for our stores and ultimately our guests. 

 A day in the life 

 All of our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities are listed below. Reporting to the Merchandising Manager, this position will work as a key component of the merchandising team, working to ensure the successful execution of merchandising strategies and product assortment to drive business growth and creative direction. 

 Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include:
 
 
 Supporting current strategies and portfolios of work 
 Supporting in the day-to-day management of building out solutions for key projects and/or programs 
 Participating in several meetings and conversations pertaining to key areas of your work 
 Support merchandising team in maintaining data integrity across systems and documents from seasonal buy to execution with the utmost accuracy. 
 Supporting with purchase order management, order creation, item creation support, on order reporting and product flow reporting. 
 Supporting with seasonal buy presentation deck creation as needed by management team. 
 Support with management of merchandising samples and set up for key gates and presentations. 
 Work cross functionally with our Planning and Ecommerce partners to ensure seamless execution of product go live Online and in Stores. 
 Provide administrative support to the merchandising team where required. 
 Nice to haves 

 
 
 Retail experience is highly desirable. 
 Ability to balance analytical and creative tasks 
 Strong knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook) 
 Purchase Order management software knowledge desirable 
 Excellent communication skills - interpersonal, written and verbal 
 You have a strong ability to work independently, under pressure and meet deadlines 
 Integrity - do what you say you will do, by when you say you will do it 
 You are organized with a keen eye for the details 
 Ability to multi task and operate in a fast-moving environment 
 · Ability to be flexible to changing business needs 
 Must haves 

 
 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 

 lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300 - $60,300 CAD annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week. 

 NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective. 

 References 

 Visible links 
1. https://pnimages.lululemon.com/content/dam/lululemon/www-images/Footer/Sustainability/lululemon_ImpactAgenda_October202023.pdf

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well.

We owe our success to our innovative product, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

We’re looking for you. Join us .

IDEA Global Internship Program

Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities.

We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path.

Our [1] Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity.

About this team

The Health & Wellbeing team supports and educates employees and leaders across the business on our benefit, compensation, and mobility programs.

A day in the life

All of our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include:
  • Answer employee queries, educate on our programs, and troubleshoot issues.
  • Ensure accuracy in our systems through regular audits and reporting.
  • Review and complete required documentation for employee events (eg. Leaves).
  • Support in providing effective ideas and programming with a focus on improving wellbeing and empowering our people through education.
Nice to haves
  • Effective communication skills (written & verbal).
  • Highly organized, attentive to detail, and able to manage multiple tasks for different projects.
  • Demonstrated or passionate commitment to supporting individual wellbeing.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Can work well both independently and collaboratively with in person and remote partners.
Must haves

  • Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.
  • Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.
  • Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same.
  • Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
  • Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
  • Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously.
Additional Notes
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role.

Compensation and Benefits Package

lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300 - $60,300 CAD annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements.

At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth:

  • Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
  • Paid time off
  • Savings and retirement plan matching
  • Generous employee discount
  • Fitness & yoga classes
  • Parenthood top-up
  • Extensive catalog of development course offerings
  • People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)
Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

workplace arrangement

This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy:

Hybrid

In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.

References

Visible links
1. https://pnimages.lululemon.com/content/dam/lululemon/www-images/Footer/Sustainability/lululemon_ImpactAgenda_October202023.pdf
positionName: IDEA Global Internship Program: Health & Wealth Intern (Vancouver)

companyInfo/companyDescription:
lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities. Setting the bar in innovation of fabrics and functional designs, lululemon works with yogis and athletes in local communities around the world for continuous research and product feedback. ​

From our roots in Vancouver, Canada, lululemon has grown across the globe and through new channels to serve guests worldwide. Our teams are focused on creating authentic connections, whether in stores with one of our educators, online with a digital educator, or in a community with one of our lululemon ambassadors.

We are a purpose-driven brand, and our values guide us in all that we do—from our business strategy and innovation, to how we connect and build our strong culture.

Impact is an essential part of our culture and underpins our business strategy. Guided by our Impact Agenda, we approach this work holistically through three pillars that address the interconnection of our products, people, the communities we serve, and the planet​.

 Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 
 Who we are 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well.

 About this team 

 The Omni & Technology Analytics team supports a portfolio of guest, educator and inventory technology products across our retail stores. Advising and assisting product owners with data integration, reporting design and implementation, program sales, inventory and labour planning and ongoing in depth analyses driving program improvements and long term strategy 

 A day in the life 

 All our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include: 

 
 
 Supporting current strategies and portfolios of work 
 Working with cross-functional partners to gain alignment on strategic projects 
 Supporting in the day-to-day management of building out solutions for key projects and/or programs 
 Participating in several meetings and conversations pertaining to key areas of your work 
 Nice to haves 

 
 
 Effective communication skills (written & verbal). 
 Extremely organized, thorough, and able to prioritize. 
 Detail orientated. 
 Self-directed problem solver, proactive and resourceful. 
 Responsible, dependable, and mature, with sound judgment. 
 Ability and willingness to accept and provide feedback. 
 Great communication skills and the ability to work within cross-functional teams. 
 Excellent team player as well as the ability to work independently. 
 Adapt quickly, learn from failures, and move forward. 
 * 

 Must haves 

 
 
 An interest in data and analytics 
 Basic Microsoft Excel skill 
 Experience with visualization tools is a plus (e.g. Qlik, Power B.I, Tableau) 
 Proficiency in SQL or relational database programs is a plus 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn't take themselves too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 

 lululemon's compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and teamperformance. Thetypical hiring range for this position is from$55,300-$60,300 annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 
 workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

description:
Close date: March 17, 2024 at 11:59pm PST* 

 
 
 Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 
 who we are 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. 

 We owe our success to our innovative product, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 We’re looking for you. Join us. 

 IDEA Global Internship Program  

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities.  

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions, and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity. 

 About this team 

 The Product Integrity Systems team has recently completed an organizational transformation and is embarking on its next exciting phase of growth. We design and operate the global product integrity system to maximize the product’s value to the guest while minimizing risk to the brand. We serve as a global centre of policy, data, document management and internal audit to all Product Integrity teams. 

 A day in the life 

 
 
 All our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include: 
 Support Product Integrity Systems team with preparing presentations and reports 
 Create process maps and assist with updating and editing of Product Integrity documentation 
 Audit and review business processes in collaboration with functional Subject Matter Experts 
 Help monitor and manage the Product Integrity Systems intake request form submissions and reports on various platforms 
 Support in the day-to-day management of building out solutions for key projects and/or programs 
 Participate in several meetings and conversations pertaining to key areas of your work 
 Nice to haves 

 
 
 Working towards qualification in Engineering, Business, or Supply Chain related field 
 Excellent communication skills and a keen attention to detail 
 Experience working with Microsoft Office suite of products (Excel, Power Point, Word, Outlook) 
 Experience with data management platforms such as PowerBI, Smartsheet and SharePoint is an asset 
 Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to excel in a highly collaborative environment 
 Extremely organized, thorough, and able to prioritize. 
 Ability and willingness to accept and provide feedback. 
 must haves 

 
 
 Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life. 
 Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results. 
 Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same. 
 Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take yourself too seriously. 
 Additional Notes 
Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 
lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $$53,300 - $60,300 CAD annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

positionName: IDEA Global Internship Program: Product Integrity Systems Intern (Vancouver, CAN)

description:
Business & Marketing Interns 
RAPS Administrative Office
We are looking to fill three positions for our 2024 Canada Summer Jobs program. Ideal candidates would be passionate about animals and also be an ambassador for our organization to the public. RAPS is a registered charity that also operates the RAPS Cat Sanctuary, RAPS Adoption and Education Centre, three Thrift Stores, and the RAPS Animal Hospital. We also have a TV docuseries "Pets & Pickers", now streaming in Canada and the US. We are a no-kill, animal serving agency.
This position is open to young people aged 15 to 30 years. For more information on eligibility requirements, please visit the Canada Summer Jobs site. You must confirm your eligibility to apply.
https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/services/funding/canada-summer-jobs/screening-eligibility.html#h3.3
This position is contingent on funding.
Marketing, Business Development, Communications & Donor Relations:

 Assist with all communications, marketing and PR efforts
 Assist with organizational development efforts in raising funds
 Assist with fundraisers and special events
 Assist with all RAPS marketing and public relations activities onsite and offsite, weekdays, weekends and evenings as required (in lieu of additional time off)
 Where appropriate, assist with any ‘on-the-grounds’ tasks that may come up

Administrative Support & General Duties:

 Remain focused (complete one task before attending to another task)
 To represent RAPS and conduct oneself professionally and responsibly at all times.
 Support the Managers with administrative support as required
 Assist frontline staff as required
 Promote team-oriented work environment; ensure that the BI works collaboratively and positively with all RAPS internal and external constituents. This includes RAPS staff, volunteers, suppliers, contractors, donors, whether or not they are online or offline supporters of the organization.
 Assisting in creating and maintaining an exceptional and enviable workplace culture
 Responsible for providing highest standard of customer and client care
 Duty of Care – to represent RAPS and conduct oneself professionally and responsibly at all times.
 Uses tact and discretion when discussing problems and eliciting sensitive or confidential information
 Interruptions are an expected part of the work, and re-prioritization and/or rescheduling of tasks is required for work completion.
 Assisting with all work-related requests from Managers in the interest of RAPS’ overall operations outside these job description requirements
 Perform any reassignment of duties required based on the business requirements of RAPS.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 12 weeks
Salary: $19.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Schedule:

 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Richmond, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

 Are you eligible for the Canada Summer Jobs Program?

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Richmond, BC
Application deadline: 2024-05-15Expected start date: 2024-06-01

companyInfo/companyDescription:
lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities. Setting the bar in innovation of fabrics and functional designs, lululemon works with yogis and athletes in local communities around the world for continuous research and product feedback. ​

From our roots in Vancouver, Canada, lululemon has grown across the globe and through new channels to serve guests worldwide. Our teams are focused on creating authentic connections, whether in stores with one of our educators, online with a digital educator, or in a community with one of our lululemon ambassadors.

We are a purpose-driven brand, and our values guide us in all that we do—from our business strategy and innovation, to how we connect and build our strong culture.

Impact is an essential part of our culture and underpins our business strategy. Guided by our Impact Agenda, we approach this work holistically through three pillars that address the interconnection of our products, people, the communities we serve, and the planet​.

 The Raw Materials Intern is a role that is doing value-added administration that supports company business foundation: data integrity, removing blocks from product workflow, participate, listen and learn best practices. Ability to perform business tasks consistently and reliably. Support function specific roles in raw material development. 

 A day in the life 

 All of our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include: 

 
 
 Supporting current strategies and portfolios of work 
 Working with cross-functional partners to gain alignment on strategic projects 
 Supporting in the day-to-day management of building out solutions for key projects and/or programs 
 Participating in several meetings and conversations pertaining to key areas of your work 
 Drive data maintenance - in all Raw Material related systems including historical data integrity/updates, support 
 Ensure data integrity 
 Organizing, requesting fabric hangers, lengths 
 Controlling all shipping/receiving packages 
 Nice to haves 

 
 
 Effective communication skills (written & verbal). 
 Extremely organized, thorough, and able to prioritize. 
 Detail orientated. 
 Self-directed problem solver, proactive and resourceful. 
 Responsible, dependable, and mature, with sound judgment. 
 Ability and willingness to accept and provide feedback. 
 Great communication skills and the ability to work within cross-functional teams. 
 Excellent team player as well as the ability to work independently. 
 Adapt quickly, learn from failures, and move forward. 
 Must haves  

 
 
 Interest in apparel/product/textile industry 
 Passion for details and discipline 
 Curiosity for change and learning, plus tolerance for ambiguity 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. 
 Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 
lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $55,300 - 60,300 annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week. 

 NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on legitimate, nondiscriminatory reasons, and not on race, colour, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances.  References

description:
多国籍国際教育・海外就職コンサルタントのカナダ支社でのインターンシップです。
以下フォロアー急上昇中の動画配信プロジェクトメンバー募集中です！
「毎日English」スキマ時間にサクッと英語学習できる動画を毎日配信！Instagram：https://www.instagram.com/success.english.qts/YouTube：https://www.youtube.com/@lifejourneyeducationTikTok：https://www.tiktok.com/@success.english.qts
会社情報：グローバル採用動画：https://youtu.be/x7CgTUUJ7GkLinkedIn(海外出張や活動の様子)：https://www.linkedin.com/company/74383883/admin/日本部署ホームページ：https://lifejourney-edu.com/国際イベント動画：https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UgKnn5pze2oビジョン動画：https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=27uC2sYuEEY日本チームインスタグラム：https://www.instagram.com/lifejourney.jp/
対象地域: カナダ＆アメリカ全土&日本(留学経験者のみ)
日本部署での募集となります。Indeed及びLinkedInからも応募者が多数のため、書類審査通過の段階まで質問等は受け付けておりませんのでご了承ください。
こんな人にオススメ！・世界を旅しながら時間と場所に縛られず自由に働きたい人・世界中の仲間と交流し、世界を股にかけた仕事がしたい人・有言実行でき、結果にこだわり結果を出せる人・自分自身のキャリア、仕事、顧客に対して責任感を持って働ける人・顧客の海外での挑戦を後押することにやりがいを感じる人・信念を貫き、途中で諦めず最後まで仕事ができる人

TikTok Project Internship - Join the Rising Trend!
Are you passionate about social media, creativity, and the ever-evolving world of online content? Do you want to be a part of one of the most exciting and rapidly growing platforms on the internet? If so, we have an incredible opportunity for you!
About Us:
Life Journey Education is a dynamic international education consulting firm committed to empowering global citizens through educational experiences. As part of our mission to stay at the forefront of the digital age, we're launching an exciting new TikTok project that aims to make a significant impact on social media.
Internship Overview:
We are seeking energetic and creative individuals to join our TikTok Project as interns. In this role, you will have the chance to:
Create Engaging Content: Develop and produce captivating TikTok content that resonates with our target audience.
Stay Trendy: Keep your finger on the pulse of TikTok trends, challenges, and viral content to inform our strategies.
Collaborate: Work closely with our marketing and creative teams to align TikTok content with our brand's vision.
Analytics and Optimization: Analyze performance metrics and use data-driven insights to optimize our TikTok strategy.
Get Creative: Experiment with different content formats and styles to find what works best.
Requirements:
Strong interest in TikTok and social media trends.Creativity and a knack for storytelling.Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.Willingness to learn and adapt quickly in a fast-paced digital environment.Basic video editing skills (experience with editing apps is a plus).
How to Apply:
To apply for this exciting TikTok Project Internship, please send your English resume and a cover letter detailing your passion for social media and why you'd be a great fit for this role to info@lifejourney-edu.com.
Join the TikTok Revolution:
Be a part of the TikTok revolution and help us shape the future of educational content in the digital age. This internship is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in social media marketing and content creation while making a meaningful impact. We look forward to welcoming creative minds like yours to our team!

TikTok Project Internship - Join the Rising Trend!

Are you passionate about social media, creativity, and the ever-evolving world of online content? Do you want to be a part of one of the most exciting and rapidly growing platforms on the internet? If so, we have an incredible opportunity for you!

About Us:

Life Journey Education is a dynamic international education consulting firm committed to empowering global citizens through educational experiences. As part of our mission to stay at the forefront of the digital age, we're launching an exciting new TikTok project that aims to make a significant impact on social media.

Internship Overview:

We are seeking energetic and creative individuals to join our TikTok Project as interns. In this role, you will have the chance to:

Create Engaging Content: Develop and produce captivating TikTok content that resonates with our target audience.

Stay Trendy: Keep your finger on the pulse of TikTok trends, challenges, and viral content to inform our strategies.

Collaborate: Work closely with our marketing and creative teams to align TikTok content with our brand's vision.

Analytics and Optimization: Analyze performance metrics and use data-driven insights to optimize our TikTok strategy.

Get Creative: Experiment with different content formats and styles to find what works best.

Requirements:

Strong interest in TikTok and social media trends.
Creativity and a knack for storytelling.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Willingness to learn and adapt quickly in a fast-paced digital environment.
Basic video editing skills (experience with editing apps is a plus).

How to Apply:

To apply for this exciting TikTok Project Internship, please send your English resume and a cover letter detailing your passion for social media and why you'd be a great fit for this role to info@lifejourney-edu.com.

Join the TikTok Revolution:

Be a part of the TikTok revolution and help us shape the future of educational content in the digital age. This internship is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in social media marketing and content creation while making a meaningful impact. We look forward to welcoming creative minds like yours to our team!

companyInfo/companyDescription: Collingwood School is an independent, non-denominational, co-educational, university-preparatory school founded in 1984. Located in West Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, it delivers the British Columbia Ministry of Education curriculum from Junior Kindergarten to Grade 12.
description:
Collingwood School is a gender inclusive day school located on two campuses in West Vancouver, BC. 

 Our vision is socially responsible students pursuing passions for a better world. We are committed to contributing positively to our local and global communities, environmental stewardship, and supporting the wellbeing, and inclusion of all people. Through the pursuit of passions, students will find their unique purpose in the world. 

 We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring a barrier-free work environment. We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers, including BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour), persons with disabilities, and 2SLGBTQ (persons of all sexual orientations and genders). If you are an applicant with a disability, we will work with you to make reasonable workplace accommodations you may need for your best work performance. 

 At Collingwood, we seek faculty and staff who live our values of courage, curiosity and community to be in service of others and, who are inspired by our mission to inspire and support young people for meaningful lives. 

 We are seeking a Spring Intern to join our school at either our Wentworth or Morven Campus. The successful candidate is a current university student who is looking to become part of a vibrant teaching and learning community. This position is a Temporary Contract and the candidate will be involved in supporting students and the school during May and June 2024 for approximately 40 hours a week from Monday to Friday. 
Responsibilities 

 
 
 Support academic classes to enhance student learning 
 Participate in coaching and/or co-curricular support 
 Supervise students at lunch and outdoor recess times 
 Support teachers on off-site field trips or other school activities 
 Provide administrative support as needed 
 Establish a respectful and safe learning environment 
 Maintain confidentiality of all information related to Collingwood School, the students, their families, and staff 
 Additional duties as required 
 Required qualifications 

 
 
 Graduate of Collingwood School 
 Currently enrolled in a continuing education program 
 Enthusiastic, energetic and welcoming personality 
 Excellent management, organizational, interpersonal and relationship skills 
 Canadian residency and legally entitled to work in Canada 
 Our “Must Haves” 

 
 
 Respect, dignity and inclusion for all members of the community 
 Collaborative mind-set and courageous approach to adversity 
 Demonstrated communications skills (oral and written) 
 Creative “out-of-the-box” thinker 
 Flexible and adaptable and embraces change 
 Proven work ethic with utmost integrity 
 Enthusiasm, eagerness and genuine interest in all aspects of the school’s success 
 Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self improvement (goal-oriented) 
 We offer professional development opportunities and competitive salaries, along with one of the most beautiful locations in Canada to work! The pay for this position is $20/hour. 
If this role is a good fit, we would love to hear from you! Please submit a cover letter detailing your suitability for the position along with your resume by April 2, 2024 to https://can232.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/cws/Posting/View/1528 

 We sincerely thank all applicants for your interest however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Please visitour website for more information about our school.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Powered by our proprietary data-driven platform, Neptune Retail Solutions offers a complete omni-channel network of proven solutions that help brands and retailers guide consumers from shopping to buying.



We are the share leader in the US and Canada in developing, producing and placing end to end in-store advertising executions. We service over 48,000 retail locations with over 3,800 employees delivering over 24MM placements each year.



Checkout 51, our owned & operated cash back shopping app, compliments and powers our programmatic digital media offering and, along with our FSI, we completely surround and guide your shoppers towards purchase in-store.



Our cultural focus on innovation and transformation continually attracts the industry's top-tier talent - resulting in a work environment that is both dynamic and diverse.
description:
Are you an energetic self-starter?
 
 
 
   Neptune Retail Solutions has immediate availability for a Part-time Merchandiser for a Rep in the
   Downtown Vancouver, BC area. This territory has approximately 6 hours per week.
 
 
   We specialize in the installation of at-the-shelf merchandising, including the iconic Instant Coupon Machine in major grocery and drug chains nationwide.
 
 
 
   This position offers:
 
 
 
   Flexible work hours
   Bi-Weekly pay with direct deposit
   Mileage reimbursement
   Managerial support and paid training
 
 
  Position Requirements:
 
   In-store Representatives must have a valid driver's license and a reliable, insured and registered personal vehicle (For some city assignments, representatives may choose alternate transportation, such as a bus or subway)
   Must be at least 18 years old
   
     Take initiative
     Work well independently with a strong work ethic
     Display focused attention to quality, detail, and accuracy
     Demonstrate adaptability to the needs of our clients, retailers, customers, and coworkers
     Ensure all work interactions are met with excellent customer service skills and professionalism
     Strong organizational skills and time-efficient
   
 
 
   Access to computer, internet and printer
   Ability to lift up to 25 pounds and stand for extended periods of time, repetitive bending, lifting and stretching
 
  Neptune Retail Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.
 
 
   Applicant Privacy Notice:
   Your personal information will be collected and used by Neptune Retail Solutions and/or its affiliated companies to process and respond to your application, contact you regarding current and future employment or internship opportunities, and as otherwise set out in our Applicant Privacy Notice available here: Applicant Privacy Notice.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Changing Clothes. Changing Conventional Wisdom. Change the World. LifeWear. 

UNIQLO is a brand of Fast Retailing Co., Ltd., a leading global Japanese retail holding company that designs, manufactures and sells clothing under seven main brands: Comptoir des Cotonniers, GU, Helmut Lang, J Brand, Princesse tam.tam, Theory, and UNIQLO. UNIQLO continues to open large-scale stores in some of the world's most important cities and locations, as part of its ongoing efforts to solidify its status as a truly global brand. Today the company has a total of more than 2,300 stores in 25 markets worldwide including Japan, France, South Korea, U.K., the U.S and many more! UNIQLO believes in LifeWear: clothing that is designed to improve everyone’s life. It is simple, high-quality, everyday clothing with a practical sense of beauty, ingenious in detail, designed with life’s need in mind and always evolving.
description:
Job Title: UNIQLO Summer Retail Internship 2024
  Reporting to: Store Manager
  Start: Jul 2024
  Duration: 8 weeks (Jul 8, 2024 – Aug 30, 2024)
  Location: Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal **Timeline and Locations may be subject to change based on business operational needs
  About UNIQLO
 
   UNIQLO is a brand of Fast Retailing Co. (FR), a global Japanese retail holding company that designs, manufactures and sells clothing under multiple brands including: GU, Theory, Helmut Lang, PLST (Plus T), COMPTOIR DES COTONNIERS, PRINCESSE TAM TAM, and UNIQLO. FR is currently among the world’s top three largest apparel retail companies and UNIQLO, its pillar, is considered Japan’s leading specialty retailer. With an operation spanning over 2300 stores worldwide in more than 25 countries and regions, UNIQLO is driven by its LifeWear concept for ultimate everyday clothes, offering unique products made from high-quality, highly functional materials, at affordable prices. UNIQLO proactively seeks to minimize the environmental impact of our businesses through the development of recycle-oriented products while continuing to offer people all over the world the joy, happiness, and satisfaction of wearing truly great clothes that embody our corporate philosophy: Changing clothes. Changing conventional wisdom. Change the world.
 
  
 
 
   At UNIQLO, we are committed to providing our employees with enriching and challenging opportunities where achievements and personal growth are acknowledged and rewarded. We are dedicated to offering our employees training, performance-based increases, and unlimited growth opportunities. If you are an ambitious, hard-working individual who welcomes new challenges, have a drive for success, and embrace the responsibility of leadership—then you belong at UNIQLO!
 
  The Store Experience:
  The UNIQLO Summer Retail Internship program offers highly motivated, talented individuals who are passionate about becoming aspiring store managers and leaders in the retail industry, the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a UNIQLO storefront. In this paid program, you will work with key members of the UNIQLO team to learn the business fundamentals of a global apparel retailer and gain experience in the day-to-day operations of the store, including customer service, Sales Floor Tasks, leadership, staff development, and business analysis.
  End of Term Project:
  In addition to supporting the business operations of your store, you will focus approximately 20% of your scheduled time on a unique project that tackles an opportunity or area of improvement at your specific store location. Examples of past projects include suggesting new marketing campaigns, increasing internal employee morale, tracking and improving customer reviews and store experience, and other localized business improvement projects. At the end of the Internship Program, you will present your project and findings to our store and corporate leaders!
  Networking and Development Opportunities:
  Further to learning various aspects of the UNIQLO store business, you will also have the opportunity to network and learn from top leaders in the retail industry. The UNIQLO Retail Internship Program is the first step in an exciting and dynamic career in store management, with the opportunity to be considered for our full-time UNIQLO Manager Candidate (UMC) Program based on interns’ performance. This program is designed for individuals who want to begin their retail management careers in UNIQLO stores.
  Desired Skills and Experience:
 
   Enrolled at an accredited university for an undergraduate or graduate degree
   Ability to work minimum 24 hours/week
   Ability to work a flexible schedule that meets needs of the business/store, including evenings and weekends
   Passion for UNIQLO and its products
   Previous retail, hospitality, or sales experience preferred
   Strong leadership experience and work ethic, self-starter and independent
   Clear aspiration to become a future business leader in the retail industry
   Effective communication skills using company platforms, including but not limited to: Microsoft Outlook, Google Suite, etc.
   Attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to prioritize
 
  UNIQLO Canada is an equal opportunity employer. UNIQLO Canada encourages applications from all qualified candidates and accommodates person with disabilities. Candidates that are selected for interviews should advise us if they require accommodation.
