Job Title: UNIQLO Summer Retail Internship 2024

Reporting to: Store Manager

Start: Jul 2024

Duration: 8 weeks (Jul 8, 2024 – Aug 30, 2024)

Location: Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal **Timeline and Locations may be subject to change based on business operational needs

About UNIQLO

UNIQLO is a brand of Fast Retailing Co. (FR), a global Japanese retail holding company that designs, manufactures and sells clothing under multiple brands including: GU, Theory, Helmut Lang, PLST (Plus T), COMPTOIR DES COTONNIERS, PRINCESSE TAM TAM, and UNIQLO. FR is currently among the world’s top three largest apparel retail companies and UNIQLO, its pillar, is considered Japan’s leading specialty retailer. With an operation spanning over 2300 stores worldwide in more than 25 countries and regions, UNIQLO is driven by its LifeWear concept for ultimate everyday clothes, offering unique products made from high-quality, highly functional materials, at affordable prices. UNIQLO proactively seeks to minimize the environmental impact of our businesses through the development of recycle-oriented products while continuing to offer people all over the world the joy, happiness, and satisfaction of wearing truly great clothes that embody our corporate philosophy: Changing clothes. Changing conventional wisdom. Change the world.
At UNIQLO, we are committed to providing our employees with enriching and challenging opportunities where achievements and personal growth are acknowledged and rewarded. We are dedicated to offering our employees training, performance-based increases, and unlimited growth opportunities. If you are an ambitious, hard-working individual who welcomes new challenges, have a drive for success, and embrace the responsibility of leadership—then you belong at UNIQLO!

The Store Experience:

The UNIQLO Summer Retail Internship program offers highly motivated, talented individuals who are passionate about becoming aspiring store managers and leaders in the retail industry, the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a UNIQLO storefront. In this paid program, you will work with key members of the UNIQLO team to learn the business fundamentals of a global apparel retailer and gain experience in the day-to-day operations of the store, including customer service, Sales Floor Tasks, leadership, staff development, and business analysis.

End of Term Project:

In addition to supporting the business operations of your store, you will focus approximately 20% of your scheduled time on a unique project that tackles an opportunity or area of improvement at your specific store location. Examples of past projects include suggesting new marketing campaigns, increasing internal employee morale, tracking and improving customer reviews and store experience, and other localized business improvement projects. At the end of the Internship Program, you will present your project and findings to our store and corporate leaders!

Networking and Development Opportunities:

Further to learning various aspects of the UNIQLO store business, you will also have the opportunity to network and learn from top leaders in the retail industry. The UNIQLO Retail Internship Program is the first step in an exciting and dynamic career in store management, with the opportunity to be considered for our full-time UNIQLO Manager Candidate (UMC) Program based on interns’ performance. This program is designed for individuals who want to begin their retail management careers in UNIQLO stores.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Enrolled at an accredited university for an undergraduate or graduate degree
  • Ability to work minimum 24 hours/week
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule that meets needs of the business/store, including evenings and weekends
  • Passion for UNIQLO and its products
  • Previous retail, hospitality, or sales experience preferred
  • Strong leadership experience and work ethic, self-starter and independent
  • Clear aspiration to become a future business leader in the retail industry
  • Effective communication skills using company platforms, including but not limited to: Microsoft Outlook, Google Suite, etc.
  • Attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to prioritize

UNIQLO Canada is an equal opportunity employer. UNIQLO Canada encourages applications from all qualified candidates and accommodates person with disabilities. Candidates that are selected for interviews should advise us if they require accommodation.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
lululemon is a technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories company for yoga, running, training, and most other activities. Setting the bar in innovation of fabrics and functional designs, lululemon works with yogis and athletes in local communities around the world for continuous research and product feedback. ​

From our roots in Vancouver, Canada, lululemon has grown across the globe and through new channels to serve guests worldwide. Our teams are focused on creating authentic connections, whether in stores with one of our educators, online with a digital educator, or in a community with one of our lululemon ambassadors.

We are a purpose-driven brand, and our values guide us in all that we do—from our business strategy and innovation, to how we connect and build our strong culture.

Impact is an essential part of our culture and underpins our business strategy. Guided by our Impact Agenda, we approach this work holistically through three pillars that address the interconnection of our products, people, the communities we serve, and the planet​.
description:
Close date: March 17, 2024 at 11:59pm PST* 

 
 
 Please note: This posting may be closed ahead of the listed close date dependent on the volume of applications received. Please submit your application as soon as possible. 
 For internal applicants/postings: Please note: if we receive a large volume of applications, we may not be able to review each application; therefore, we recommend applying early. 

 For external applicants/postings: Please note: if we receive a large volume of applications, we may need to close this posting early and ahead of the closing date; therefore, we recommend applying early. 

 Who we are 

 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. 

 We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. 

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program 

 Our IDEA Global Internship Program is a full-time, paid internship for select roles within our Store Support Centre (Head Office) roles. The 2024 program will run 12 weeks, from June 3 to August 23. Interns will receive support, coaching and mentorship, gain practical work experience, and develop new skills to expand their career possibilities. 

 We’ve designed a variety of exciting, fun and thoughtful sessions and experiences throughout the program. There will also be opportunities to connect, collaborate and build relationships with interns across the globe. All interns follow two tracks of learning: the in-depth learning and skillset relevant to their role and the broad breadth knowledge of our business operations. Our IDEA Global Internship Program curates a journey for each intern to discover where their passions lie and helps them lay out their career path. 

 Our Be Human Impact Agenda goal is to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in around the world by 2025. We are cultivating an environment and building systems that create and sustain inclusion, diversity, and equity 

 About this team 

 Our team is fast-paced and taking on exciting new initiatives to support a fast-growing business. We strive to adopt leading-edge technology and seek to continuously improve on our solutions. We aren’t afraid to try new things, we have fun and we encourage each other to take on new challenges. We support each other in growing professionally and personally. We fail forward and learn from our mistakes, thus creating a better path ahead. We create space for team members to share feedback and ideas that can help us continually grow as an organization. 

 We institute a culture of fun and lightheartedness to enjoy work every day. We are inclusive and know that we are stronger as a team than as an individual. 

 A day in the life 

 All of our interns play an important role in our business and are key members of the team. 

 Some of the tasks, roles and responsibilities include:
 
 
 Collaborate with tech managers, leads, and other partners 
 Participate in design discussions and code reviews to learn best practices for our engineering teams 
 Develop product features using software engineering best practices 
 Contribute to process improvements 
 Documenting approach and results 
 Challenging’s assumptions and looking for creative solutions 
 Attending planning meetings as required 
 Nice to haves 

 
 Must be pursuing a degree in Software, Engineering, Computer Science or related field or experience 
 Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced environment 
 Willingness to learn new technologies 
 Analytical and logical thinker 
 Passion for solving problems and desire to understand how things work 
 Passion for quality and relentless improvement 
 Strong communication skills and can easily work with cross functional teams 
 Must haves 

 
 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life. 
 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. 
 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. 
 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. 
 NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective. 

 Compensation and Benefits Package 
lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $67,800- $72,800 annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program subject to program eligibility requirements. 

 At lululemon, investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. We strive to be the place where inclusive leaders come to develop and enable all to be well. Recognizing our teams for their performance and dedication, other components of our total rewards offerings include support of career development, wellbeing, and personal growth: 

 
 
 Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans 
 Paid time off 
 Savings and retirement plan matching 
 Generous employee discount 
 Fitness & yoga classes 
 Parenthood top-up 
 Extensive catalog of development course offerings 
 People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few) 
 Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice. 

 Workplace arrangement 

 This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: 

 Hybrid 

 In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

Who we are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well.

We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. description:
About Healthcare Consulting
Healthcare Consulting specializes in providing top-quality staffing solutions to healthcare facilities across the country. We work with hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and other healthcare facilities to provide them with skilled healthcare professionals to meet their staffing needs.
We are hiring a Registered Nurse in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Reasons To Join Our Team:

 Wide Range of Opportunities: We work with a variety of healthcare facilities across the country, which means that we can offer our candidates a wide range of opportunities to choose from. Whether you're looking for a temporary assignment, a permanent position, or something in between, we can help you find the right fit.
 Competitive Compensation: We offer competitive compensation packages to our candidates, which includes salary or hourly pay, benefits, and other perks. We understand that compensation is an important factor in your decision-making process, and we strive to offer our candidates the best possible packages.
 Professional Development: We provide our candidates with opportunities for professional development and growth. We offer continuing education courses, mentorship programs, and other resources to help you enhance your skills and advance your career.
 Personalized Attention: We take a personalized approach to our staffing solutions, which means that we work closely with our candidates to understand their needs and preferences. We take the time to get to know you and your career goals, so we can help you find the best opportunities for your individual needs.
 Supportive Team: We have a supportive and experienced team of recruiters and staffing specialists who are dedicated to helping our candidates succeed. We are available to answer any questions you may have and provide ongoing support throughout your assignments.

We are Hiring a Registered Nurse:
We require our Registered Nurse to be licensed in British Colombia.
What You'll Be Doing in This Role:
Shift Supervisor: Registered nurses are responsible for overseeing and supervising the nursing staff on their shift, ensuring that everyone is on task and performing their duties efficiently and effectively.
Patient Triage: In emergency departments and urgent care settings, registered nurses often play a key role in patient triage, determining the order in which patients are seen based on the severity of their condition.
Clinical Expert: Registered nurses are often highly experienced and act as clinical experts on the unit, providing guidance to less experienced staff and assisting with complex patient cases.
Resource Allocator: They allocate resources, including staff, equipment, and supplies, to ensure that the unit operates smoothly and that patient needs are met.
Quality Monitor: Registered nurses monitor and maintain the quality of care on the unit, ensuring that protocols and standards are followed and that any deviations or issues are addressed promptly.
Patient and Family Liaison: They often serve as a point of contact for patients and their families, addressing concerns, providing information, and facilitating communication between the healthcare team and the patients.
Policy and Procedure Enforcer: Registered nurses are responsible for ensuring that all nursing policies and procedures are followed by the staff on their shift, and they may also be involved in updating these policies as needed.
Conflict Resolution: They are skilled in conflict resolution, addressing disputes and issues that arise among staff members and working to maintain a harmonious work environment.
Emergency Response Coordinator: In the event of medical emergencies, Registered nurses coordinate the response within their unit, ensuring that the appropriate interventions are implemented quickly and efficiently.
Report Writer: Registered nurses often generate shift reports, summarizing key events, patient statuses, and any noteworthy incidents during their shift for communication to the next shift or for administrative purposes.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract, Casual, Seasonal, Internship / Co-opContract length: 12 months
Salary: $50.00-$60.00 per hour
Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 On-site parking

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Evening shift
 Monday to Friday
 Morning shift
 Night shift
 On call
 Overtime
 Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

 Overtime pay

Education:

 Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

 Registered Nurse: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

 Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-03-21

description:
Sister Company: North Media Group
Location: Vancouver, Canada (Must be A Canadian Citizen)
Job Type: Part-Time Internship
Experience: No prior Experience Needed
About Us:North Media Group is Canada's fastest-growing media/news outlet on social media, connecting Canadians to their cities through a diverse network. Our primary target audience is Gen Z and young millennials, and we strive to distribute content in the most easily digestible way.
Responsibilities:

 Generate, edit, and share a minimum of 5-10 pieces of engaging content daily on each social account (Instagram + Tiktok) (e.g., original text, photos, videos, and news via Canva)
 Ensure content provided aligns with ZLR Media & North Media groups brand voice, current benchmark trends, and audience preferences
 Ensure content is not against the platform’s community guidelines or terms of service
 Compose engaging cultural captions on posts, maintaining unified brand consistency and voice across different social media channels
 Collaboratively work with account managers to grow social media platforms by developing, editing, and posting high-quality engaging content on North Media group's social media platforms and accounts
 Track and keep up to date with all relevant national news and events, developing creative content to ensure North Media Group becomes part of the conversation
 Post with the highest standard of clarity, accuracy, professionalism, and integrity
 Booking and conducting calls to better understand client needs if needed

Job Type: InternshipContract length: 4 months
Salary: $16.75 per hour
Expected hours: 3 – 10 per week
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Flexible schedule
 Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 On call

Experience:

 Marketing: 1 year (preferred)
 Social media management: 1 year (preferred)

Location:

 Vancouver, BC (required)

Work Location: In person

Expected start date: 2024-03-21
descriptionHTML:
About Healthcare Consulting

Healthcare Consulting specializes in providing top-quality staffing solutions to healthcare facilities across the country. We work with hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and other healthcare facilities to provide them with skilled healthcare professionals to meet their staffing needs.

We are hiring a Registered Nurse in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Reasons To Join Our Team:

  • Wide Range of Opportunities: We work with a variety of healthcare facilities across the country, which means that we can offer our candidates a wide range of opportunities to choose from. Whether you're looking for a temporary assignment, a permanent position, or something in between, we can help you find the right fit.
  • Competitive Compensation: We offer competitive compensation packages to our candidates, which includes salary or hourly pay, benefits, and other perks. We understand that compensation is an important factor in your decision-making process, and we strive to offer our candidates the best possible packages.
  • Professional Development: We provide our candidates with opportunities for professional development and growth. We offer continuing education courses, mentorship programs, and other resources to help you enhance your skills and advance your career.
  • Personalized Attention: We take a personalized approach to our staffing solutions, which means that we work closely with our candidates to understand their needs and preferences. We take the time to get to know you and your career goals, so we can help you find the best opportunities for your individual needs.
  • Supportive Team: We have a supportive and experienced team of recruiters and staffing specialists who are dedicated to helping our candidates succeed. We are available to answer any questions you may have and provide ongoing support throughout your assignments.

We are Hiring a Registered Nurse:

We require our Registered Nurse to be licensed in British Colombia.

What You'll Be Doing in This Role:

Shift Supervisor: Registered nurses are responsible for overseeing and supervising the nursing staff on their shift, ensuring that everyone is on task and performing their duties efficiently and effectively.

Patient Triage: In emergency departments and urgent care settings, registered nurses often play a key role in patient triage, determining the order in which patients are seen based on the severity of their condition.

Clinical Expert: Registered nurses are often highly experienced and act as clinical experts on the unit, providing guidance to less experienced staff and assisting with complex patient cases.

Resource Allocator: They allocate resources, including staff, equipment, and supplies, to ensure that the unit operates smoothly and that patient needs are met.

Quality Monitor: Registered nurses monitor and maintain the quality of care on the unit, ensuring that protocols and standards are followed and that any deviations or issues are addressed promptly.

Patient and Family Liaison: They often serve as a point of contact for patients and their families, addressing concerns, providing information, and facilitating communication between the healthcare team and the patients.

Policy and Procedure Enforcer: Registered nurses are responsible for ensuring that all nursing policies and procedures are followed by the staff on their shift, and they may also be involved in updating these policies as needed.

Conflict Resolution: They are skilled in conflict resolution, addressing disputes and issues that arise among staff members and working to maintain a harmonious work environment.

Emergency Response Coordinator: In the event of medical emergencies, Registered nurses coordinate the response within their unit, ensuring that the appropriate interventions are implemented quickly and efficiently.

Report Writer: Registered nurses often generate shift reports, summarizing key events, patient statuses, and any noteworthy incidents during their shift for communication to the next shift or for administrative purposes.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract, Casual, Seasonal, Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 3-6 months

Salary: $50.00-$60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Morning shift
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

  • Overtime pay

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Registered Nurse: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)

Work Location: In person

Expected start date: 2024-03-21

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Our "about us" is really about you.
We have always been a different kind of financial services firm, embracing long-term planning, valuing methodical decision-making and remaining focused on what matters most: You.

About Us 
When Bob James founded Raymond James, he did so based on a belief that clients deserved more than help with investment decisions, they needed advice that considered their entire financial picture.

Today, that client-focused approach has extended to serve client accounts through 8,100 financial advisors in the United States, Canada and overseas. Further, the company has expanded through the years to serve corporations, institutions and municipalities through significant capital markets, banking and asset management services.

No matter the business, we believe if we do what’s right for clients,
we’ll help them achieve success while also realizing our own.
It’s that simple.
description:
Enterprise Data Intern
  
   2400878
  
 
 
 
   At Raymond James, we develop, we collaborate, we decide, we deliver, and we improve together. 
   Raymond James Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent investment dealers offering high quality investment products and services to Canadians seeking customized solutions to their wealth management needs. 
   
  Enterprise Data Intern
   
   
   How does the role impact the organization? 
  Under the direction of the Senior Manager, Enterprise Data, this intern position will be included in conducting full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. You will be exposed to assisting the business in turning data into information, turning information into insight and insight into decisions.
   
   
   What will your role be responsible for? 
  
   Interprets data and analyzes results using statistical techniques. 
   Provides reports regularly; Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality; Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources; 
   Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets; 
   Collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate complex information with attention to detail and accuracy; 
   Compilation of requirements and data mapping documentation; 
   Filters and “cleans” data, reviews computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems; 
   Knowledge of data models, data profiling, data mapping and data mining; 
   Profiles data sources using SQL and other data discovery tools in support of data quality analysis and business intelligence design efforts; 
   Creates detailed business requirements for functional (e.g., business processes, rules) and non-functional (e.g., data, security) capabilities; 
   Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities; 
   Partners with team members to develop reports and documentation; and 
   Performs other duties and responsibilities as asset 
   
  What We Offer: 
   Immerse yourself in a hands-on experience within our dynamic and collaborative work environment, where seasoned professionals offer mentorship and guidance. This unique opportunity providing you with unparalleled exposure to diverse facets of finance and operations within the industry. Furthermore, you'll have the chance to actively engage and network with seasoned professionals, fostering connections that will undoubtedly contribute to your professional growth and development. Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals.
 
 
 
   What do we expect from you? 
   To qualify for this opportunity, you possess: 
  Experience and Skills 
   
   Completing a Diploma of Technology, Bachelor’s degree in Computer 
   Science, MIS, Business or a related field; Database design and development experience as asset; and 
   Experience in the financial services industry preferred but not required. 
   
  Knowledge of the following: 
   
   Relational databases, data models, database design principles, data mining and segmentation techniques; Reporting packages, databases (SQL, etc.); 
   Experience using software packages for analyzing large datasets; 
   Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings;and 
   Familiarity with database reporting tools (Report server, Power BI server) is an asset. 
   
  Competencies and Behaviors: 
   
   Analysis: Identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities; compare data from different sources to draw conclusions. 
   Communication: Clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message. 
   Exercising Judgment and Decision Making: Use effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; recommend or take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and probable consequences. 
   Technical and Professional Knowledge: Demonstrate a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; remains current with developments and trends in areas of expertise. 
   Building Effective Relationships: Develop and use collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals. 
   Client Focus: Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; develop and sustain productive client relationships. 
   
  We encourage our interns to: 
   
   Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same 
   Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes 
   Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind 
   Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter 
   
  At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. 
   Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process. 
   Salary Range: BC (based on Education, Work Experience, etc) $25-$30 hourly.
 
 
 
   Job Technology
 
 
   Primary Location CA-BC-Burnaby-Burnaby
 
 
   Organization IT
 
 
   Schedule Part-time
 
 
   Status Temporary Part-Time

companyInfo/companyDescription:
GHD is one of the world’s leading engineering, architecture and environmental consulting companies. 

Established in 1928, GHD employs more than 5,800 people across five continents and serves clients in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation. 

The cornerstone of our business is our client-centred culture and teamwork-based approach known as One GHD. Operating globally and delivering services locally, we are united by the core values of Teamwork, Respect and Integrity.
 
Wholly-owned by its people, GHD is dedicated to understanding and helping our clients achieve their goals. Our global network of engineers, architects, planners, scientists, project managers and drafters collaborate to improve the built, economic and social environment of the communities in which we operate.
 
GHD is committed to sustainable development, safety and innovation. We care for the wellbeing of our people, assist communities in need and conduct business in an ethical and environmentally responsible manner.
description:
There’s no pledge more important than the one we make to look after our environment, and we’re committed to helping you do exactly that. 
 Do you have an interest in science, engineering, and/or the environment? 
 Are you interested in learning skills to bring back to your own community, or continuing to work with GHD to support other Indigenous communities? 
 If Yes, we’d love to see you apply! We offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, with meaningful and welcoming mentorship opportunities for our interns. 
 Who are we looking for? 
 We are currently hiring for an Indigenous Intern to work with our Design and Project Management groups on First Nation Solid Waste Management, Environmental Remediation, Water Management, Renewable Energy, and Emergency Response Planning projects. This position is a paid internship position. We are currently providing technical assistance to Indigenous Peoples across Canada to develop recycling systems, improve waste collection, design water treatment systems and reduce diesel combustion in off-grid communities. 
 The objective of GHD’s Indigenous Internship Program is to be able to give students who self-identify as a member of the indigenous community the opportunity to work in a consulting environmental on Indigenous projects in Canada. It is GHD’s hope that after the program, successful interns will be able to give back to their communities directly or return to GHD and continue to work with other Indigenous communities. 
 Bring your curiosity and passion to the technical challenges we solve at GHD. Then see how everyone gets behind you. 
 Join us as we strive to ensure a sustainable future for our communities and the world we live in. Become part of our global network of skilled engineers, scientists, auditors, planners and environmental specialists, all working together to leave this world better than we found it. 
 Working with an energetic and high performing team, this position offers a variety of work and will see you involved in: 
 
  Assist with client and contractor communications including preparation and delivery of presentations and meeting records 
  Meet Indigenous community representatives and assist in determining local needs and objectives, possibly including preliminary site visits 
  Conduct research for projects 
  Prepare documents including Indigenous Services Canada funding applications, project progress and completion reports, and project memorandums 
  Provide support for project administration tasks 
  Participate in design meetings and project team meetings 
 
 What you will bring to the team: 
 
  Preference will be given to Indigenous candidates (First Nations status or non-status, Metis, and Inuit) 
  Post-secondary education (currently enrolled or recent graduation, or an equivalent combination of education and work/life experience) 
  Demonstrate an interest in science, engineering, and/or the environment through work, education, and/or volunteer experience 
  Positive attitude 
  Written and verbal communication abilities 
  Valid driver's license 
 
 #LI-JR2 
 Take on some of the world’s toughest challenges - with everyone at GHD backing you every step of the way. 
 We'll give you control over your career, empower you to find innovative solutions and help you create a lasting impact. 
 See where your commitment could take you with GHD. 
 EEO Statement Canada: As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. 
 Salary Range: $22.50 - $27.00/hour (based on experience)

description:
ARCHITECT and INTERN ARCHITECTS
Grout McTavish Architecture is a growing studio-scaled practice with a vision to provide its clients and their projects a high standard of design and technical excellence in planning, architecture and interior design consulting.
We are looking for talented Architects and intermediate intern Architects with 5 - 10 years of Canadian or US experience. We believe the right person can play a lead role on our design and working drawing teams for various airport, university and mixed use institutional projects.
The following are some of the professional qualities we seek:

 A self-directed individual with well proven communication and leadership skills
 Record of maintaining high quality standards while working to tight deadlines
 Design and functional planning strengths
 Strong organizational and problem solving skills
 Current experience in Revit is essential
 Experience in F&B and tenant Fit-out work is preferred
 LEED accreditation an asset.
 Familiarity with the National and BC Building code
 Construction administration and detailing experience an asset
 Candidates applying for the Intern Architect Position must be registered with the AIBC, or eligible to be registered in the province of British Columbia.

Thank you in advance for your response, however only those chosen for interviews will be contacted. No phone calls please.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $70,000.00-$90,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Extended health care
 Flexible schedule
 Life insurance
 Vision care

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 Architecture: 5 years (required)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-03-18

description:
Engineering Co-op Student - Civil - VAN00EG
 
 
   Company: Worley
 
 
   Primary Location: CAN-BC-Vancouver
 
 
   Job: Civil
 
 
   Schedule: Part-time
 
 
   Employment Type: Employee
 
 
   Job Level: Apprenticeship
 
 
   Job Posting: Mar 6, 2024
 
 
   Unposting Date: Apr 5, 2024
 
 
   Reporting Manager Title: Managing Consultant Ports & Marine
 
 
   :
 
 
 
   Engineering Co-op Student - Civil 
  Worley Consulting Group 
   Vancouver, BC 
   
  
   Worley Consulting. Be part of the solution. 
  
  
   The dual challenge of supplying energy to a growing population, while addressing the risks of climate change, is one of the greatest challenges the world is facing today. The energy transition isn’t just about alternative fuels, power generation, or use, or storage. It’s all the elements that contribute to the energy ecosystem. We view these challenges as opportunities to deliver a more sustainable world.
    
    We’re developing strategies and business cases for emissions intensive clients to move to low carbon energy options, as efficiently and safely as possible. Our consultants are advising customers on circular and hydrogen economies, water stewardship, electrification, and climate change risk and adaptation. We work on projects around the globe. The problems our global and so are we.
  
   
   
  
    Who we are:
   
   
   Advanced Analysis 
   Asset Advisory 
   Decommissioning and Restoration 
   Energy Transition and Sustainability 
   Environment and Society 
   Geosciences 
   Market Services 
   Safety Consulting 
   Transport, Infrastructure & Logistics 
   Water
  
   
   
  
    Challenging complexity. Shaping a sustainable future.
   
  
    Economic viability. Resource availability. Digital reliability. Carbon neutrality. These are the components of the world’s pressing energy and resource problems. Sound complicated and tough to balance? It is.
  
   
   
  
    Luckily we thrive in complex environments
   
  
    Join a community of consultants, scientists, strategists, and engineers all dedicated to solving the world’s critical infrastructure, environmental, energy, and resource challenges. By seeing things from a different perspective, we enhance the Worley Group’s ability to serve our clients. We are together delivering a more sustainable world.
  
   
  
    
  
  
   We put sustainability at the heart of everything we do
   
  
    We work with business to develop the right strategy, log in to a digital future, secure and safeguard social license, enhance local communities, and power the energy transition.
   
  
    We know we won’t solve today’s problems by using the same thinking that created them. So, from start to finish, we challenge ourselves to find the best way forward. We question every decision, assumption, and way of working to make sure we get it right. The first time.
  
   
   
  
    Rising to the challenge, together
   
   
  
   We are thousands of consultants across the globe. Be part of the future – welcome to our growing team!.
   
   
  Overall Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities 
   
   Supports senior staff with small projects from planning to implementation. Typical tasks include: 
    
     Developing work plans and budgets. 
     Determination of client requirements. 
     Detailed analysis and design. 
     Preparation of project deliverables including drawings, specifications, and reports. 
     Field work including inspections and review during construction. 
     Client liaison 
    
   Supports senior staff on larger projects. Typical tasks include: 
    
     Detailed analysis and design. 
     Inter-discipline coordination. 
     Assisting with project reporting. 
     
  
 
 
  Qualifications 
   
   Experience with civil design, structural analysis software, and Microsoft Office is preferred 
   Good communication skills both written and verbal 
   Excellent organizational and time management skills 
   Exceptional interpersonal skills 
   
  Please note: No agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy. 
   Worley Consulting offers an excellent remuneration & benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within Canada and overseas. 
   We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company. 
   We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Worley Consulting is an equal opportunity employer.

  • Supports senior staff with small projects from planning to implementation. Typical tasks include:
    • Developing work plans and budgets.
    • Determination of client requirements.
    • Detailed analysis and design.
    • Preparation of project deliverables including drawings, specifications, and reports.
    • Field work including inspections and review during construction.
    • Client liaison
  • Supports senior staff on larger projects. Typical tasks include:
    • Detailed analysis and design.
    • Inter-discipline coordination.
    • Assisting with project reporting.

Qualifications

  • Experience with civil design, structural analysis software, and Microsoft Office is preferred
  • Good communication skills both written and verbal
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills

Please note: No agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy.

Worley Consulting offers an excellent remuneration & benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within Canada and overseas.

We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Worley Consulting is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy ️
  We’re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion. 
 If changing the world wasn’t incentive enough, here’s why you should join us:
 
  We designed, built, and operated the world’s leading stellarators.
 
  We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.
 
  We know what we’re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.
 
  We’ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.
 
  Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.
 
  If you are searching for the best new ideas and share our vision, join us as a “Summer Intern- Computational Physicist”. This is what you need to know:
  Location: Vancouver, BC
  Salary: CA$1000/week for a 12-week contract
  Contract: 12-week contract
  Reporting to: Senior Scientist
  Your role in the mission:
 
  In this role you will help develop the computational tools to design and demonstrate the scientific validity of our fusion reactor concepts. You will run our growing suite of codes in the C/C++, Fortran, Python and Julia languages to predict and analyse the plasma performance of stellarator configurations under consideration. You will work closely with our team of scientists to meet the milestones associated with your projects. 
 Proficiency in C++/Fortran, Python, or Julia is required. Experience with scientific computing and high-performance computing is desirable, as is experience with collaborative code development efforts and with distributed version control software (e.g. Github).
  
 
  
   Develop scientific software in any of the specified languages. 
  Work closely with senior scientists to develop computational tools that will strengthen our reactor design codes and our ability to validate design choices. 
  Adopt our collaborative software development framework based on Github, through documentation and unit testing of your codes before deployment. 
  Collaborate with your research colleagues who are mostly PhDs with a strong background in stellarator science. 
  Monitor and track the progress of your projects using Jira. 
 
  What you’ll need:
  
   Currently undertaking a degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or a related field 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  Proficiency in C++/Fortran, Python, or Julia is required. 
  Experience in writing unit tests and documenting code. 
  Experience in using git and CI/CD pipelines is desirable. 
  Background in scientific computing and high-performance computing is desirable. Ability to work independently and closely with senior colleagues. 
 
 
  
 Embrace the mission by submitting your application on our careers page, then head over to our website to learn more about the revolutionary team behind Stellarator technology.
  About Us:
  Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. 
 At Type One Energy we believe that our employees are our greatest asset. We are committed to creating a positive and supportive work environment where everyone feels valued and respected. We value diversity, inclusion, and equity, and are committed to providing our employees with the resources and opportunities they need to succeed
  The company was formed in 2019 by a team of globally-recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in successfully scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. 
 Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system. Its FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. For more information, visit https://www.typeoneenergy.com/.
  Equal Opportunity Statement
  Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces, support injured workers, and sustain a no-fault insurance system. We are honoured to serve 2.3 million workers and 255,000 employers across B.C.

To discover opportunities for a career that makes a difference, visit worksafebc.com/careers
description:
Job requisition number
        
       038530 
      
      
       
        Job location
        
       Richmond 
      
      
       
        Full-time / part-time
        
       Full-time 
      
      
       
        Salary
        
       $22.38/hourly 
      
      
       
        Posting period 
       
       From 03/04/2024 to 03/15/2024 
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    Overview 
    
     The Accounting Services department of WorkSafeBC is looking for one highly motivated Co-op student, Accounting Services to join our team to help us strive towards our vision. 
     The student will assist with the accounting and travel expense administrative functions in our department. This is an eight-month temporary opportunity starting in May 2024. 
     How you’ll make a difference: You’ll apply what you’ve learned in your post-secondary program to benefit workers and employers across B.C. 
     Where you’ll work 
     At WorkSafeBC, we offer a hybrid work model that combines the convenience of working remotely with the dynamism of working in one of our offices, based on the operational needs of the position. 
     In this role, you'll work primarily on-site in our Richmond office at a minimum of four days per week and occasionally from you B.C. home. 
    
    What you'll do 
    
     
      Perform travel expense administration with a policy focus, expense analysis and Excel spreadsheet development activities 
      Accounts payable duties 
      Participate in ongoing projects relating to the needs of the team and operational activities 
      Gather data to perform analysis as required 
      Conduct reconciliations and verification of data and information from our internal and external clients 
      Document procedures for any ad-hoc analysis and review and update training manual as needed 
      Support professional and administrative ad-hoc tasks related to the needs of the team such as event planning or meeting preparation 
      Perform administrative duties 
     
    
    Is this a good fit for you? 
    
     We're looking for someone who can: 
     
      Demonstrate strong analysis and spreadsheet skills - think outside the box 
      Communicate effectively, both in writing and verbally 
      Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills when interacting with all levels of management 
      Demonstrate strong organization skills and attention to detail 
      Demonstrate strong teamwork skills 
      Demonstrate self-motivation and an ability to work with limited supervision 
      
     Learn more: Hear from past co-op students on what it’s like to work here. 
     Your experience and educational background: 
     
      Third or Fourth year student enrolled in a business program or have taken some accounting courses. 
      Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office software suite (Excel, Word). 
      Previous co-op or relevant work experience in an office environment is preferred. 
      
     Important to know 
     Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must: 
     
      Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada 
      Confirm you’re a registered student at a post-secondary institution 
      
     WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect. 
     Who are we? 
     At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province. 
     What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC? 
     It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for. 
     
      Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.
     
      
      
     Our Benefits 
     As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work - and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes: 
     
      4% in lieu of benefits 
      4% in lieu of vacation 
      
     Salary: $22.38/hourly 
     Learn more: Discover who we are. 
     Want to apply? 
     
      A cover letter, resume and transcript are required. Your cover letter should state your availability (either four or eight months). 
      Submit all documents in one file (either Word or PDF files). 
      You must apply by 4:30 p.m. PST on the closing date. 
      We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

companyInfo/companyDescription: DECO Windshield Repair has been operating since 2005 and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name for windshield repair, crack repair, and windshield Glass Treatment application across Canada.
description:
$17.75/hr + Commission + Tips
Average First Year Operator Wage: $24.00/hr
Are you a top performer? Do you love to work independently? Do you have what it takes to become a team member at DECO Windshield Repair?
DECO operates seasonally from March to November and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name across Canada for windshield repair and our repair plans.
We are now hiring full-time/part-time Site Operators across Canada and specifically in Delta for our 2024 Season!
Summary:
As a Site Operator with DECO you'll be communicating with customers, repairing windshield damage, selling repair plans, and servicing our existing repair plan customers; all while providing the customer an unforgettable experience. The best part? You'll be outside all day independently running your own kiosk while still being part of a team.
With support from an experienced manager in a fun company culture that likes to work hard and play hard, you are in for the best season of your life!
Requirements:
- Must have excellent people and verbal skills and be willing to engage with customers
- Sales experience is preferred
- Must be driven, motivated, and independent
- Be able to stand for long periods of time
- Access to a vehicle is a requirement
Although sales experience is preferred, no previous experience is necessary to work at DECO since we provide extensive training both on-site and off-site. We pay a base wage and a competitive commission structure based on your individual sales, each day.
At DECO Windshield Repair we pay our employee's top of market; however - you have to earn it.
No handouts here. If you're looking for a job where you can work independently and be responsible for you own wage and earnings, we invite you to apply. Top performers only!
Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience and performance. The range listed is just one component of DECO's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, tips, trips (Calgary Stampede + Mexico Trip) and many region-specific benefits and events.Salary Range Transparency$17.75 - 24.00+ per hour

Salary: $17.75-$24.00 per hour
Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday
 Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay
 Commission pay
 Retention bonus
 Tips

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Official EY Indeed Account. Join us as we ask #BetterQuestions and discuss topics that matter to you, the workplace, and the future of business.

At EY, we’re dedicated to helping organizations solve their toughest challenges and realize their greatest ambitions - from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies – and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.

Through our four service lines — Assurance, Consulting, Strategy and Transactions, and Tax — we help our clients capitalize on transformative opportunities. We also help them fulfill regulatory requirements, keep investors informed and meet the needs of all of their stakeholders. And in a fast-changing world, we give them the support they need to be effective today and create long-term value for tomorrow.

Across all disciplines and from every angle, EY professionals draw on our shared creativity, experience, judgment and diverse perspectives to reframe the future for our clients – now, next and beyond.
description:
What if your career could have a lasting impact on you, and on the world?
 
  Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and, in the future, – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.
 
  The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
 
  The opportunity: your next adventure awaits
 
  EY has an established industry leading Strategy and Transactions (SaT) Services practice. We help clients determine the right deal to do, and then assist them in doing the deal right. We are a growing practice that has the resources to serve any client, anywhere in the world. With so many offerings, you will have the opportunity to develop your career in a friendly, collaborative environment through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.
 
  Our infrastructure advisory team is a specialty sub-practice of SaT. The team is trusted by public sector ministries and agencies, as well as by private sector companies, for its expertise in infrastructure strategy, financing, structuring, modeling and management of procurement and delivery processes. We advise through the full lifecycle of core infrastructure projects and public-private partnerships across Canada and globally. We advise across asset classes including transportation (e.g., transit, highways, airports), healthcare, environmental (e.g., waste), energy, mining, social infrastructure, schools, and municipal facilities. We are regularly named by our industry publications as Financial Advisor of the Year in Canada and the Americas.
 
  Building, operating, and maintaining an asset is all about making intelligent decisions, powered by accurate information. As an Infrastructure Advisory Co-op, you’ll help make that happen. You will be an important part of our diversely talented, highly experienced team and work at the forefront of high-profile transactions and projects. When you join our industry-leading team, you’ll be right at the heart of that challenge, working with leading business tools and methodologies to provide professional services to some of the most sophisticated clients around.
 
  As a Co-op, you will have an integral role that involves working closely with other members of the national Infrastructure Advisory team to execute a variety of engagements related to the planning, development, delivery, and operations of major infrastructure projects. You will prepare drafts of reports and presentations for client meetings and communicate complex analyses clearly. You will also undertake quantitative and qualitative analysis, including the construction of project finance models as well as research accounting, tax, and financial market information to be used in modelling, scenario analysis and negotiation support. You will also have the opportunity to support the strategic planning for and drafting of proposals whilst building knowledge of the infrastructure sector and its related capital markets and supply chains.
 
  As we are client facing, we expect our Co-ops to demonstrate professionalism and competence in the client's environment. To maintain a strong client focus, be responsive to client requests, and to develop/maintain productive working relationships with client personnel. Co-ops should be informed of current business/economic developments relevant to the client's business and collaborate with team members to set goals and responsibilities for the project.
 
  If you’re ready to build on your potential, develop as a Strategy & Transactions professional, and join a growing team, this role is for you. Sound interesting? Well, this is just the beginning. Visit our website here to learn more.
 
  What we look for
 
   You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
   You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
   You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
   Qualifications:
   
     Be pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree (Bachelor of Commerce or Engineering preferred)
     Have advanced written and verbal communication skills
     Possess strong dedication to teamwork
     Be committed to integrity within a professional environment
     Interest in exploring a professional designation, such as a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or Project Management Professional (PMP)
   
 
  What’s in it for you
 
   Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
   Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally.
   Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
   Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients, and society – building a better working world, together.
   A comprehensive Total Rewards package that incorporates medical & health benefits, including $5,000 for mental health and a pro-rated fitness allowance for your time at EY.
 
  What you can expect
 
   We are currently accepting applications for a Co-op in our Strategy and Transactions – Infrastructure Advisory group for May 2024.
   To apply, please create a profile, and submit your most recent cover letter, resume, and unofficial transcripts as one single PDF document.
   Within a week of submitting your PDF application, you will be provided with a link to complete the video component of your application. You will have 48 hours to complete this video. All candidates must complete this video as part of the application process.
   Successful applicants will be contacted for behavioral interview(s) with members of our Strategy and Transactions practice and/or Talent Attraction and Acquisition team.
 
  Diversity and Inclusion at EY
 
  Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. We embrace diversity and are committed to combating systemic racism, advocating for the LGBT+ community, promoting our Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, and are dedicated to amplifying the voices of Indigenous people (First Nations, Inuit, and Métis) nationally as we strive towards reconciliation. Our diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.world.
 
  Find out why time and again we're recognized as one of Canada's top employers. To learn more about career opportunities with us, visit us at
 
  Please note: Due to high volumes of applicants and varying local deadlines, only successful applicants moving forward to an interview will be contacted.
