description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
 Job Description Summary: 
 
 The Test R&D Engineer, Co-op will work with the Opto-mechanical Test R&D team to ensure we develop high quality products within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio. Test R&D engineers design test methods and supporting fixtures, evaluate product designs through testing, and ensure our products meet Stryker’s high standards for product quality while meeting the needs of our customers and our business. The role requires someone who has great communication, problem-solving, and technical skills.
 
  Essential Functions:
 
   Participate as part of the Test R&D team throughout development from design feasibility up to product launch.
   Work closely with cross-functional teams including Project Managers, Design, Quality, Manufacturing, etc.
   Assist in the design and development of test methods and fixtures to support new product development within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio.
   Perform testing throughout the project and appropriately documenting procedures and results
   Evaluate design options and bench testing to help inform decisions in product development.
   Support prototyping efforts for product development and test fixturing. 
 
 
 Qualifications:
 
   Education:
   
     Third year undergrad or higher in mechanical, optical, mechatronics, or other related engineering fields.
   
   Knowledge:
   
     Experience with CAD software (preferably SolidWorks)
     Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (i.e., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
     Experience with data compilation and analysis
     Ability to create technical documentation when required.
   
   General Skills:
   
     Excellent written and oral communication
     Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
     Ability to manage priorities and workflow to meet commitments.
     Versatility and flexibility to work in a job environment that may have consistently changing priorities.
     Proven ability to handle projects and meet deadlines.
     Strong interpersonal skills
     Good judgement with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
     Self-managed and motivated
   
 
 
  About Stryker Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.
descriptionHTML:
Why engineering at Stryker?

At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development.

Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team

Job Description Summary:

The Test R&D Engineer, Co-op will work with the Opto-mechanical Test R&D team to ensure we develop high quality products within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio. Test R&D engineers design test methods and supporting fixtures, evaluate product designs through testing, and ensure our products meet Stryker’s high standards for product quality while meeting the needs of our customers and our business. The role requires someone who has great communication, problem-solving, and technical skills.

Essential Functions:

  • Participate as part of the Test R&D team throughout development from design feasibility up to product launch.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams including Project Managers, Design, Quality, Manufacturing, etc.
  • Assist in the design and development of test methods and fixtures to support new product development within Stryker Endoscopy’s product portfolio.
  • Perform testing throughout the project and appropriately documenting procedures and results
  • Evaluate design options and bench testing to help inform decisions in product development.
  • Support prototyping efforts for product development and test fixturing.

Qualifications:

  • Education:
    • Third year undergrad or higher in mechanical, optical, mechatronics, or other related engineering fields.
  • Knowledge:
    • Experience with CAD software (preferably SolidWorks)
    • Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (i.e., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
    • Experience with data compilation and analysis
    • Ability to create technical documentation when required.
  • General Skills:
    • Excellent written and oral communication
    • Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
    • Ability to manage priorities and workflow to meet commitments.
    • Versatility and flexibility to work in a job environment that may have consistently changing priorities.
    • Proven ability to handle projects and meet deadlines.
    • Strong interpersonal skills
    • Good judgement with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
    • Self-managed and motivated

About Stryker
Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Fairleigh Dickinson University is a private, coeducational and nonsectarian university founded in 1942. Fairleigh Dickinson University is the first American university to own and operate an international campus and currently offers more than 100 individual degree programs to its students.
description:
General Description:
 
 
   The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will identify, establish, and maintain relationships with industry partners, and collaborating with faculty members to facilitate and coordinate practicum placements and other work-integrated learning opportunities that align with student and program goals. By providing overall administrative support in accordance with FDU policies and protocols, the Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator will conduct tasks such as guiding employers to facilitate meaningful student work experiences and successful placements, recruiting students for the work-integrated learning program, designing and delivering internship orientation and pre-employment training (in-person and online), advising students to prepare for internship search, monitoring student work terms, visiting practicum sites and addressing any workplace issues that students encounter, and marketing the program to employers.
 
  
   Supervision Received: 
 
 
  The Work Integrated Learning Program Coordinator reports to the Associate Director of Career Services and receives supervision concerning objectives to be achieved. The incumbent is expected to work independently and collaboratively on daily tasks and special projects, as well as collaborate with other key internal and external constituent groups. 
   
   Principal Duties: Student Advising 
 
 
  1. Provide employment coaching and overall guidance to students towards developing realistic goals and internship search plan based on their program of study.
   
 
 
  2. Design, develop, and facilitate comprehensive job search workshops and training sessions on all aspects of work-integrated learning goals and career development.
   
 
 
  3. Assist students with job application preparation, job search strategies and interview preparation through one-on-one appointments.
   
 
 
  4. Provide relevant and accurate information regarding the internship process and requirements.
   
 
 
  5. Monitor and provide ongoing support during and after completion of the internship program.
 
 
 
    Employer and Faculty Relations
   
 
 
  1. Manage, liaise with, and grow a base of internship employers by researching and developing internship opportunities based on the needs of student interns and their programs of study.
   
 
 
  2. Liaise with corporations, government agencies, and employment service providers for internship placements.
   
 
 
  3. Assist employers with onboarding student interns.
   
 
 
  4. Conduct internship site visits to evaluate student performance in the workplace and help resolve performance issues.
   
 
 
  5. Collaborate with faculty members to identify work-integrated learning opportunities that align with program objectives and student learning outcomes.
   
 
 
  6. Work closely with faculty to integrate work-integrated learning components into the curriculum at the course or program level.
   
 
 
  7. Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
 
 
 
   Direction to Others
 
 
   None
 
  
   Standards: 
 
 
  1. Understand and effectively communicate Campus and Department policies, procedures, and practices.
   
 
 
  2. Use strong communication skills and judgment in all contact with industry partners, faculty, students, and staff members.
   
 
 
  3. Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
   
 
 
  4. Carry out duties without direct or immediate supervision and work on a diversity of projects simultaneously, using independent judgment and discretion.
   
 
 
  5. Independently compose correspondence and other materials, and handle correspondence/reports with a very high level of accuracy.
   
 
 
  6. Well organized, results oriented, and able to set priorities and manage time efficiently.
   
 Required Qualifications: 
 
   Minimum Qualifications: 
 
 
  1. A minimum of an undergraduate degree in Business or in a discipline that emphasizes career development, counseling, experiential learning, adult education, management, communication, or a related discipline.
   
 
 
  2. A minimum of 3+ years of related work experience in work-integrated learning or co-op coordination, recruitment, human resources, or business development.
 
 
   3. Previous experience in providing career advising or counselling services to post-secondary students preferred.
   
 
 
  4. Ability to liaise with industry partners to develop and maintain relationships.
   
 
 
  5. Excellent interpersonal skills, enthusiastic, proactive, and motivated in managing partner relationships.
   
 
 
  6. Ability to be thorough, accurate, and have a high level of attention to detail.
   
 
 
  7. Superior communications skills. Ease at public speaking.
   
 
 
  8. Fluency in a second language and experience with international students/employers an asset.
   
 
 
  9. Canadian residency or work permit required.
   
 
 
  10. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory background check. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the background check and produce a Social Insurance Number.
   
 Preferred Qualifications: Hours Worked 
 
  35
  Posting Date: 02/23/2024 Special Instructions to Applicants: Application Types Accepted: Application for Employment

description:
Indigenous Internship / Auxiliary Appointment –  Summer 2024 
   Named one of BC’s Top Employers for five years running, the BCUC is an independent regulatory  agency of the Government of British Columbia. We ensure that residents and businesses receive  safe, reliable energy and basic auto insurance at fair rates. The BCUC also regulates common carrier  pipeline operations, and we promote market competitiveness by collecting and publishing  information about gasoline and diesel fuel activities in BC. We facilitate fair, transparent, and  inclusive regulatory processes that balance ratepayer interests with the needs of regulated entities  to earn a fair return on their capital investments. 
   About the role: this position is intended to be an engaging and immersive experience that provides  Vision: the successful candidate(s) with opportunities to learn about public utility regulation and to 
   contribute innovative ideas based on their unique perspective as an Indigenous person.  To be a trusted  and respected Working with the BCUC Lead for Indigenous Relations, the successful candidate(s) will: 
   regulator that identify projects/activities that support their interests and skillset(s) and collaboratively  contributes to develop a corresponding workplan for the term of their employment;  the well-being shadow senior BCUC staff and Commissioners to learn from their experience; and  and long-term  interests of all attend regulatory meetings and support proceedings as a member of staff.  British  Columbians. About you: this position is open to students and recent graduates of relevant post-secondary 
   undergraduate and graduate degree programs (e.g., Indigenous studies, law, accounting, energy  management, economics, public policy), as well as professionals with an equivalent combination of 
   experience who currently work with an Indigenous group/organization within BC. 
   The successful candidate(s) will: 
    have lived experience as part of an Indigenous community (or communities); 
   
    have experience with, knowledge of, and/or interest in Indigenous communities, 
   Values: governments, and organizations in BC, as well as energy system(s) and regulation, including 
    Accessibility Indigenous-led energy projects, best practices and emerging trends; 
   Integrity enjoy collaborating and engaging with individuals from a diversity of backgrounds; 
   
    bring strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills; and 
   Responsiveness 
   
    be a resident of BC. 
   Innovation 
   Expected pay range: $25 - 35/hour for students and recent graduates; $30 - 50/hour for established  Excellence professionals. Exact offering within these ranges will be commensurate with a candidate’s education 
   and experience level. 
   Duration: temporary full-time from May - August 2024, or some other mutually agreed upon term.  Exact start and end dates to be confirmed with the successful candidate(s). The BCUC is also open to  discussing flexible working arrangements to ensure accessibility. 
   How to apply: please submit a résumé and cover letter explaining why you are interested in the  opportunity to careers@bcuc.com. 
   Applications will be held in the strictest of confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest,  however, only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Tools, tips, and trends from Hootsuite. Since 2008, we’ve helped social pros build brands, delight customers, and get so much done that they can actually take the occasional day off.
description:
Title: Co-op, Graphic Design 
  Location: #5 East 8th Avenue, Vancouver, BC 
  Term: 4 months 
  Start Date: May 2024, summer term only 
  Openings: 1 
  Overview: 
  We're looking for a self-driven student seeking a co-op opportunity with a high profile tech company. You'll be working as a Graphic Designer to play an essential role in the creation of design and production solutions across different media and print design. Working within the Brand team this role will implement projects with accuracy and attention to detail; research and develop thoughtful, strategic campaigns; participate in stakeholder presentations; ensure deadlines are met for a successful launch; and learn from tracking performance results.
  
  
  WHAT YOU'LL DO: 
  
  Design and produce a wide range of deliverables for social, email, web, digital paid ads, sales and internal collateral, and print-based projects with defined objectives and strategies 
  Ensure designs are on brand and aligned with our brand purpose 
  Work collaboratively on team-based projects within established timeframes 
  Be responsible for all design components of the project from initial ideation and refinement through to final deliverables 
  Concept development and presentation — work collaboratively with a team of creative experts (writers, illustrators, photographers, motion designers, and/or videographers) to build, present, and execute brand campaigns and programs with a fluency in all social channels 
  Present to, and interact with a variety of internal and external audiences and stakeholders 
  Keep an eye on the details, communicating with the team throughout the project, organization and multitasking 
  Work collaboratively with team members, and work independently at various stages of a project 
  Work with project management tools like Wrike, managing multiple projects with numerous deadlines, mindful of budgets and capable of ensuring measurable results with scalable processes.
 
  
  
  WHAT YOU'LL NEED: 
  
  Working towards a degree or diploma in Graphic Design and/or Interaction Design 
  Accountability: holds self and others accountable to meet commitments 
  Commitment to Results: consistently achieves results, demonstrating high performance, and challenging self and others to deliver results 
  Collaboration and Teamwork: works with others to deliver results, meaningfully contributing to the team and prioritizing group needs over individual needs 
  Creativity and Innovation: seeks new and better ways of doing things, generates original and imaginative ideas, products, or solutions 
  Open Communication: clearly conveys thoughts, both written and verbally, listening attentively and asking questions for clarification and understanding
 
  
  
  WHO YOU ARE: 
  
  Tenacious. You are determined to succeed, and you are motivated by the success of customers, colleagues and the community. 
  Curious. You are always learning and seeking ways to make things better. 
  Conscientious. You keep your promises, taking your commitments to others seriously, and you have strong integrity. 
  Humble. You lead with humility and empathy, respecting and learning from the perspectives of others.
 
  
  
  
 In all we do, our six guiding principles light the way: 
  Step Up: Show the world what it looks like to live and work by these guiding principles. #StepUp 
  One Team: Make Hootsuite a place where everyone feels safe, welcome, valued, and empowered to do their best work without compromising who they are. #OneTeam #FreeToBeMe 
  Customer Obsessed: Focus relentlessly on helping our customers succeed. #CustomerObsessed 
  Go Fast, Be Agile: Widen our competitive advantage by committing to speed and simplicity over perfection and complexity. #GoFastBeAgile 
  Play to Win: Commit to building an incredible, profitable company for our customers, our employees, and our stakeholders. #PlayToWin #NoExcuses 
  Neighbours & Allies: Give back to our communities and be an ally. #SocialForGood #Allies
  
  
  Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
 
 
   Canada Pay Range For This Role
  
    $46,100—$55,400 CAD

description:
Organization Description: 
Continuing the 40-year-old legacy of Architectural expertise of David Eaton Architect we have now metamorphized to ParaMorph Architecture Inc. with the same passion & commitment.
ParaMorph Architecture Inc. merges collaboration, creativity, and practical innovation to serve diverse sectors such as commercial, multi-family, industrial, mixed-use & institutional projects across British Columbia. Specializing in Parametric design, we craft dynamic, responsive structures that integrate seamlessly with their surroundings. Join our cozy studio nestled in the heart of Surrey’s innovation & technology hub to shape the future of architecture together.
Visit www.paramorph.com to learn more about our work.
Job Description: 
We are seeking an experienced Intern Architect with 8-10 years of professional experience in multifamily & commercial development to join our Surrey studio in a permanent full-time position. The ideal candidate will have expertise in the preparation of construction drawings, development permit drawings, & building permit applications.
Requirements: 
Candidates will be involved in all areas of architectural practice from planning through to construction. Our studio’s approach is a collaborative one, allowing our employees to work on a broad spectrum of project types, at various stages with support and mentorship.

 Must be fully registered or be fully registered with AIBC as an Intern Architect
 Ability to manage timelines with continued proficiency is a must
 Strong understanding of Building Bylaw, BC Building Code & other relevant Municipal Zoning Regulations
 Detailed understanding of construction systems – wood frame, steel, and concrete.
 Detailed understanding of building envelope design.
 Proficiency in AutoCAD & Revit. Knowledge of Sketchup, Photoshop, Lumion, & Bluebeam is an asset.
 Expertise in creating thorough, high-quality sets of drawings, with design understanding & excellent graphic skills to prepare presentation materials & construction documents
 Liaison with interdisciplinary experts & external professionals like clients, contractors, consultants etc., effectively
 Ability to work independently & as a part of team
 Proof of eligibility to work in Canada
 Excellent communication (written & verbal) & interpersonal skills with positive can-do attitude

We offer: 

 Collaborative work environment for steady growth
 Competitive salary as per industry standards
 Monthly learning opportunities
 Strong hands-on leadership & mentorship
 Support for Internship in Architecture
 No cost onsite Gym & Wellness studio
 Great medical & dental benefits
 Close to transit for an easy commute

Contact Info:
Please submit your resume & portfolio by email to hr@paramorph.com with the subject heading: Intern Architect Feb 2024.
Due to the high volume of applications, only selected candidates will be contacted for interviews.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80,000.00-$90,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Company events
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Discounted or free food
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 On-site gym
 Paid time off
 Tuition reimbursement
 Vision care
 Wellness program

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

 Surrey, BC V3T 4J1 (preferred)

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Delta is home to a population of approximately 100,000 people. The community takes great pride in its past as well as its sustainable future. Delta offers diverse amenities including a hospital; an airport; a museum and archives; libraries; sports and recreational facilities; and many bike and walking trails in

a varied network of parks including waterfront parks on the Fraser River, Boundary Bay and the Strait of Georgia.



Employees at the City of Delta play a key role in developing and maintaining the high quality of services we provide to the community. If you are motivated, talented, professional and committed to making a positive difference in the workplace and providing excellence in customer service, consider joining our team.
descriptionHTML:
Engineering Summer Student (Special Projects)
Delta, British Columbia, Canada

Location: City Hall
Employment group: CUPE Local 454
Hours of Work: 32 Hour Work Week
Job ID: 24-79 EX

One of the sunniest regions in BC’s Lower Mainland, Delta embraces three unique communities – Ladner, North Delta and Tsawwassen. The City of Delta is looking for dedicated individuals to join our team and share in our commitment to lead the way in public service excellence.

Job Location: Delta, British Columbia, Canada
Term: Approximately 4 months (May to August 2024)
Applicable disciplines within the above departments: CIVIL

Delta is a vibrant municipality that is rich in soil and water, rich in history and industry, and especially rich in people. Situated in the “delta” of the Fraser River, Delta is home to a population of more than 108,000 residents. With the support of a strong farming and agricultural foundation, we pride ourselves on our past and our sustainable future.

We have an exciting opportunity for a co-op/summer student to join the Engineering department. The successful candidate will work in a supportive team with the opportunity to attain a broad range of engineering experience including utilities, development, transportation, steep slopes and flood protection.


Under the general direction of the Engineering Services Manager, you will be responsible for the following assignments:

  • Reviewing highway use permits for third-party utilities;
  • Coordinating third party utility relocations;
  • Reviewing traffic management plans;
  • Researching and drafting utilities-related Bylaw amendments to support future growth;
  • Preparing an inventory of Delta’s seawalls;
  • Preparing a master cost estimate spreadsheet for municipal infrastructure;
  • Assisting with reviewing development-related drawings, reports, and analyses and providing feedback to your superior; and
  • Performing a variety of inspections and tasks when needed.

Desirable Training and Experience:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Strong customer service skills;
  • Skilled in the use of Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint;
  • Experience with AutoCAD would be an asset; and,
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Required Licences:

  • A valid Class 5 BC Driver’s Licence is required.

Preference will be given to applicants currently enrolled in an undergraduate program with a focus on civil engineering studies. Previous experience related to development, construction, utilities and/or municipal engineering services would be an asset.


We thank all applicants for their interest; only those under consideration will be contacted.
Copies of relevant professional certificates, degrees, or tickets must be submitted with your application.
Preferred candidates will be required to submit a Police Information Check.

descriptionHTML:
```Duties```
- Develop and implement art lesson plans for students of various ages and skill levels
- Teach students various art techniques, including drawing, painting, and sculpture
- Provide guidance and feedback to students to help them improve their artistic skills
- Create a positive and engaging learning environment in the art classroom
- Organize and maintain art supplies and materials
- Collaborate with other teachers and staff to integrate art into the overall curriculum
- Plan and coordinate art exhibits or showcases to display student artwork

```Qualifications```
- Bachelor's degree in Art Education or a related field
- Previous experience teaching art to students, preferably in a classroom setting
- Knowledge of various art techniques and mediums
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills
- Patience and the ability to work with students of different ages and skill levels
- Creativity and the ability to inspire students' artistic expression
- Familiarity with early childhood education principles is a plus

This position requires a passion for art education, the ability to educate and inspire students and experience working with children. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in art, excellent communication skills, and the ability to create a positive learning environment. We would love to hear from you if you are enthusiastic about teaching art and helping students explore their creativity.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At CTA we’re in love with architecture.

Chernoff Thompson Architects is an architectural firm based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

Established in 1981 in Vancouver, we have continued to expand our scope of practice with projects throughout BC, across Canada and the USA. We also have affiliated firms under overlapping ownership: Chernoff Thompson Architects in Prince George, BC and Jensen Chernoff Thompson Architects in Victoria, BC. Currently, we have active projects in British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, Prince Edward Island, Washington State and Hawaii. Our goodwill, financial stability and knowledge will continue to sustain and contribute to the wellbeing of society.
description:
Junior Intern Architect - Chernoff Thompson Architects (Downtown Vancouver) 
Compensation: Salary range of $50,000 - $66,000 – note candidates with less experience, and less qualifications may have salary range adjusted accordingly.Employment type: Full-time 
Chernoff Thompson Architects has a position available for a team member that is a graduate from an architectural program and is an Intern Architect registered with the AIBC, or eligible for registration with the AIBC within approximately 6 months. We are looking for well-rounded team members with experience or potential in all aspects of design, documentation and construction. We have a number of high tech/biotech private sector and institutional clients, and currently have projects for many different post-secondary institutions in Canada and the United States, as well as various projects for all levels of government.
We are looking for team players, who are comfortable working with clients and consultants and have a high interest in design, detailing, and construction documents. We are looking for team members who will benefit from working in small groups and directly with our Partners and Associates.
Ideal candidates will have: 

 Registration as an Intern Architect with the AIBC or eligibility for such within six months
 Graduation from a University professional degree in the study of Architecture from a Canadian or equivalent institution
 At least 1 and up to 3 years' experience in British Columbia or equivalent jurisdiction
 Excellent English language verbal and written skills
 Outstanding design skills
 Working knowledge of and skills in producing design and construction documents in Revit and Autocad
 Experience in institutional building types
 Understanding of conventional drawing communication for construction drawings, some experience in preparing base drawings in Autocad and Revit
 Ability to produce high quality 3-D renderings in a variety of software platforms, including Lumion

You will:

 Work closely with one or more Partners or Associates and on teams of 3-6 persons
 Bring a collaborative and enthusiastic attitude
 Bring a high level of attention to detail to all your work.

We offer:

 An international team, supportive of diversity, including a long-standing ratio of minimum 50% women/men in the studio.
 Strong hands-on partner leadership and mentorship.
 Competitive salaries renewed annually along with cost of living increase considerations.
 Open concept work environment, close to transit.
 A LEED® office environment, including bike and gym facilities.
 LEED® accreditation recognition.
 Support for intern architect time logging and AIBC oral review preparation
 For long term employees financial support for professional development and registration.

Please provide the following to info@cta.bc.ca:

 Cover Letter indicating interest in the position (PDF).
 Resume (PDF).
 Maximum 10 pages of printable PDF attachments indicating representative portfolio work.
 Current Work Visa status and dates of such or confirmation that you are a Canadian citizen or Permanent Resident.

Per current Provincial Health Regulations, and adjusted from time to time with current health & safety guidelines, this position is intended to be a primary (100%) in-office position during a 3-6 month probation period. Currently, it will continue to be a primarily in-office position with an option to work from home up to 20% of the time after the probation period with currently mandating Monday/Thursday attendance in office. This may be adjusted time to time. Accommodation in line with provincial regulations will be assessed on an individual basis.
Note that we require COVID vaccination, including booster(s), and provide up to 4 hours paid time for each vaccination.
No phone calls please. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $50,000.00-$66,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Company events
 Dental care
 Extended health care
 On-site gym
 Paid time off
 Vision care

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Overtime pay

Ability to Commute:

 Vancouver, BC V6E 3C9 (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Vancouver, BC V6E 3C9: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription:
At Francl Architecture, the creative and intelligent evolution of both the design process and the craft of architecture guides our work. The depth of our engagement with clients, users and stakeholders generates sophisticated responses to the unique constellation of social, cultural and environmental concerns of each project. We thrive on the challenge to design and realize a genuinely modern, livable, and sustainable built environment.
We are a diverse and talented team of 50+, working in a collaborative studio environment, located in the Armoury District in Vancouver. Individuals take responsibility for projects from design to completion in a number of sectors, including infrastructure, institutional and recreational as well as mixed-use residential.
description:
Do you want to make a positive impact on the communities we live in? Do you believe that Architecture and good design matters? Are you looking for an office environment that will support and foster your growth?
At Francl Architecture, we thrive on the challenge to design and realize a genuinely modern, livable, and sustainable built environments. Our diverse and talented team of designers work in a collaborative studio environment located in Yaletown in Vancouver, and we offer integrated design services across multiple disciplines in Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Planning and Urban Design and a range of sectors, including institutional, recreational, transportation, civic infrastructure, and mixed-use residential projects.
We are excited to work in teams, expect integrity with a strong focus on quality, are results oriented and above all, we treat each other with respect. We are a diverse group of people, and our office culture supports growth for all our staff. If you would like to find out more details about joining an exceptional team and an enriching learning environment, we would love to hear from you.
POSITION:
Architectural Co-Op Student
We are seeking an architectural student in our design studio during the summer semester from May to September 2024, with flexibility on the beginning and end dates. This is a fixed-term full-time position (37.5 hr / week) in person employment in our vibrant office located in the Yaletown neighborhood of Vancouver. We support our students with mentorship, learning opportunities and exposure to a variety of projects and office activities.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The successful student candidate will be working in a team environment on a variety of projects and stages of design phases. We strive to ensure that students experience all aspects of our practice and we work with students to ensure their time with us is enriching and fulfilling. Students will work directly with a project team and will have access to a mentor that will provide guidance and support. Students may also be engaged with office initiatives with senior staff in the office.
EXPERIENCE
We are seeking students of all experience levels.
SKILLS

 Excellent sense for design and a strong ability to develop design concepts


 Excellence in communication, strong willingness to ask questions and seek guidance


 Motivated team player and self-starter with strong organizational skills


 Proficiency in Revit, Rhino and Adobe Creative Suite is preferred.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 months
Salary: $25.68-$25.75 per year
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Extended health care
 On-site parking

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 AutoCAD: 1 year (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 Vancouver, BC V6B 2W7 (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Vancouver, BC V6B 2W7: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-04-02

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That’s why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind. 

We care about the communities we serve—because they’re our communities too. This allows us to assess what’s needed and connect our expertise, to appreciate nuances and envision what’s never been considered, to bring together diverse perspectives so we can collaborate toward a shared success.  

We’re designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. 

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. Visit us at Stantec.com/careers
description:
Civil Engineering Co-op Student - Water (Summer 2024) - ( 240000QS ) 
 Description 
 Many of the world’s top engineers and scientists come together in our Water business because they view a community’s interaction with water a bit differently—as a single holistic system, rather than unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. Working throughout the hydrologic cycle, we are delivering sustainable solutions to make sure water is where it should be and available when needed. Our experts guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Every day, we help communities improve, reuse, and protect this precious resource for future generations. By 2025 we’re hiring 2,000 people (like you) to join our team. Grow with us, H2O+U. 
 Your Opportunity 
 In this position you will have the opportunity to work our Water team as a junior project coordinator intern for a 4month term. This is a great opportunity for a motivated, energetic individual who wants to challenge their abilities in a dynamic work environment. 
 Your Key Responsibilities 
 
  Works closely with the project team to maintain a current and accurate understanding of project status, issues and changes. 
  Assisting technical staff with various project tasks including researching, compiling, and evaluating project data, preparing reports, and performing calculations for water and wastewater treatment projects. 
  Provides support to project management and team members to adhere to client standards, Stantec required procedures, and document management. 
  With guidance, assists with the preparation of high quality, accurate and timely documents such as: reports, minutes, submittals and comments tracking, as well as other required documentation. 
  Follows record retention policies. 
  With guidance, coordinate, organize, schedule, and facilitate meetings and workshops. 
  Records, composes, and distributes meeting minutes. 
  Provides general team support / office support functions as required. 
 
 Qualifications 
 Your Capabilities and Credentials 
 
  Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and assignments. 
  Good written and verbal communications. 
  Good analytical skills 
  Must be detail-oriented, and resourceful. 
  Must have good interpersonal skills. 
  Must be able to successfully work both collaboratively and independently. 
  Experience with MS Office including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Access. 
 
 Education and Experience 
 
  Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s in Engineering. 
 
 Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather. 
 This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice. 
 Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. 
 Pay transparency laws require employers to provide the following information for positions that may be in the following jurisdiction(s): 
 Salary Range(s): 
 
  Lower Mainland $25.03 - Lower Mainland $28.03 Min/Max Pay Range for postings located in BC (Lower Mainland includes Vancouver & Burnaby) 
 
 The final agreed upon compensation is based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. At Stantec certain roles are bonus eligible. 
 Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off. 
 Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account. 
 The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements. 
 Primary Location : Canada-British Columbia-Burnaby 
 Organization : BC-1117 Water-CA British Columbia 
 Employee Status : Temporary 
 Job Level : Entry Level 
 Travel : No 
 Schedule : Full-time 
 Job Posting : Feb 14, 2024, 11:22:12 AM 
 Req ID: 240000QS

We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans

The final agreed upon compensation is based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. At Stantec certain roles are bonus eligible.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Heidelberg Materials provides sustainable and digital building solutions that are transforming our industry. We think and act long-term and our solutions go well beyond cement, aggregates and ready-mixed concrete. The Heidelberg Materials team is evolving our portfolio, products and services, providing the materials to build our future.

Previously known as Lehigh Hanson, Heidelberg Materials North America operates more than 450 locations with approximately 9,000 employees in the U.S. and Canada.

Our future is sustainable. Our future is digital. Heidelberg Materials is progressive, driving change and transforming the industry for the benefit of our customers, shareholders, employees and communities.
description:
AutoReqId: 19418BR 
 Pay Class: Salaried Non-Exempt 
 Pay Rate: 20.00 - 24.00/hr 
 Department: Quality 
 Line of Business: Aggregates 
 Position Type: Internship 
 Job Posting: 
 Heidelberg Materials is seeking a Quality Control Co-Op Student to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. As a Quality Control Co-Op Student you will be responsible for aggregate and hot mix asphalt sampling and testing as well as process control as part of the production team ensuring appropriate product quality. The Co Op is slated to run from May to September 2023. Come grow your career with an industry leader! 
 Heidelberg Materials provides the materials to build our future. Our future is sustainable. Our future is digital. And it goes beyond cement, aggregates and ready-mixed concrete. Heidelberg Materials North America, previously known as Lehigh Hanson, operates more than 450 locations with approximately 9,000 employees in the U.S. and Canada. 
 What You Will Get to Do: 
 
  Sample on-site aggregate and hot-mix asphalt at various stages of production 
  Test raw materials according to specification 
  Calibrate, clean and maintain production tools and testing equipment 
  Record and report test results to management 
  Work in conjunction with production personnel to evaluate problems with quality 
 
 Who We Are Looking For: 
 
  Minimum Grade 12 education, preference given to applicable post-secondary education 
  Quality control, manufacturing, or production experience is an asset 
  Demonstrated basic math skills 
  Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team 
  Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision 
  Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions 
  In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to 75 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain 
  Ability to work a flexible work schedule including different shifts and overtime when needed

companyInfo/companyDescription:
RentSimple is a Property Management company based in Northern Virginia that provides the daily oversight of residential real estate assets for our clients.

We are a small team of energetic people ready to bring in the next person to join our growing company.
description:
Position: Marketing Co-op
Location: West Vancouver, BC, Canada
Duration: Four Months
Start Date: May 1st
About RentSimple:
RentSimple is an early-stage technology startup on a mission to improve the rental housing crisis. Our platform connects students, immigrants, and young professionals with our database of nearly 1,000,000 verified rental units. We are striving to make the search and leasing process seamless, transparent, and hassle-free. At RentSimple, we believe in creating value for both renters and property owners, using technology to simplify the rental experience.
Role Overview:
As a Marketing Co-op at RentSimple, you will be an integral part of our team, helping to form our brand and engage our target audience. Since we are very early stage, there will be opportunities to wear various hats from generating social content, helping design pitch decks, and manage our influencer relations.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development and execution of marketing campaigns across various social channels, specifically Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn.
Analyze market trends and competitor activities to provide actionable insights.
Support the organization and execution of promotional events and trade shows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales and product development, to align marketing strategies with company goals.
Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing initiatives, using data to drive decisions and improvements.
Engage with our community through social media channels, fostering positive relationships and feedback loops.
What RentSimple Offers:
Learn from our marketing advisors / influencers (total reach 17M).
iPhone + MacBook.
Hybrid if you like working from home or full access to our office.
Will come out of this co-op with an impressive marketing portfolio of work to point at.
Hands-on experience in a fast-growing startup environment.
Young and energetic team.
A collaborative, supportive, and fun team culture.
Not stuck in the office, we will be out viewing and filming high end rentals across BC.
Professional development and networking opportunities.
Opportunity to work on projects that directly impact the business.
Flexible hours.
Weekly team lunches.
How to Apply:
Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio/work samples to jack@rent-simple.com with the subject line "Marketing Co-op Application". In your cover letter, please explain why you are interested in working with RentSimple and how your skills and experiences make you a perfect fit for this role.
RentSimple is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Job Types: Seasonal, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 months
Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour
Expected hours: 35 per week
Benefits:

 Company events
 Discounted or free food
 On-site parking

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay

Education:

 Secondary School (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 West Vancouver, BC (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 West Vancouver, BC: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024-03-19Expected start date: 2024-05-01

description:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
 At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
 Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  
 BASIC FUNCTION
 
  This role will support the systems team with cross-disciplinary solutions for an Endoscopy product.
  It will be a mix of design/testing (40%), and technical writing/meetings/quality management system
  development (60%).
  
 
  This 8-month co-op term is preferably aimed at applicants in their 3rd or 4th year of a Biomedical, Electrical,
  Integrated, Mechatronics (or similar) program. It would be advantageous to have completed a previous co-op
  term.
  
 
  This position is not a remote only position, it may be hybrid depending upon the nature of projects.
  This position provides an opportunity to learn about the design requirements of medical devices and how to
  define product and platform them, with the successful applicant participating in activities including writing
  requirements, designing test fixtures or tools, and prototyping.
 
  RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  Primarily: assisting with the design of various aspects of an Endoscopy product offering.
  Evaluating design options and bench testing to determine acceptability criteria and optimal solutions given
  constrained timelines.
  
 
  Providing progress updates in design reviews as required.
  Supporting prototyping and new product development.
  Designing and building test fixtures and jigs in support of verification and product testing, as needed.
  Producing DHF documentation such as requirements, protocols and test reports.
  Additional responsibilities may include assisting in assembly of prototype devices, development of optomechanical
  jigs & fixtures, research on injection molding methods & materials, and supporting the project
  manager as required.
  GENERAL:
  While working with a team of engineers and under the supervision of a senior engineer, the co-op will be
  expected to engage on some of the following types of activities:
  
 
  Quality Management System DHF/DMR development on new and existing products, including documentation,
  meetings, and liaising across cross-functional teams.
  
 
  Participate in front-end conceptual design and engineering activities on new products.
  Sourcing components and identifying appropriate vendors.
  Product and component testing both in the form of early laboratory prototypes and final, formal product
  verification testing.
  
 
  Design of test setups and testing conditions to investigate options for improving device performance.
  May work with vendor engineers to design systems, and during early design stages to perform evaluations
  and experiments.
  
 
  Participate in design reviews, risk management and associated risk control assessment.
  Understand and follow proper procedures and best practices; work with senior engineers to improve them.
  Actively contribute to and respect team decisions; strive for and abide by consensus; operate within Company
  core values.
  
 
  Contribute to project planning and commit to deliverable goals. Proactively report progress to project
  management and R&D management when required.
  
 
  Take direction as needed from senior engineers and R&D managers; complete most tasks with minimal
  guidance; use resources responsibly and effectively.
  
 
  Proactively seek out senior technical leaders and managers as necessary.
 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS
 
   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
   
  
   Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 kilograms of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force
   frequently to lift, carry, etc. generally involves sitting most of the time.
   
  
   Must be able to communicate with groups of people.
   Must be able to review printed materials.
   Ability to use common office equipment.
   MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
   
  
   Self-managed, self-motivated, with excellent hands-on problem-solving skills.
   Must be able to generate and explain design objectives.
   Must be able to complete detailed documentation accurately. Astute attention to detail.
   Must demonstrate creative thinking and paper-based problem-solving ability.
   Must be able to review and troubleshoot designs and provide constructive feedback. Listens to others within
   the team environment to understand their thinking.
   SKILLS/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
   
  
   Self-managed and self-motivated work ethic is critical given the nature of position (some remote work, largely
   without constant oversight)
   
  
   Hands-on problem-solving skills
   Fluent with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, etc.).
   Experience in any CAD modeling software.
   Experience in programming and basic of SDLC
   Debugging skills on basic EE, SW and Assembly
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
   Proven ability to write procedures and present complex problems and solutions.
   EDUCATION/TRAINING REQUIRED
   
  
   Enrolled in an engineering program – preferably 3rd or 4th year of an Engineering program (EE, Biomedical,
   Integrated, Biomechanics, or similar)
   
  
   Available for an 8-month co-op term at minimum
  
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
  The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

MENTAL REQUIREMENTS

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

  • Hands-on problem-solving skills

  • Experience in programming and basic of SDLC
  • Debugging skills on basic EE, SW and Assembly
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

EDUCATION/TRAINING REQUIRED

Integrated, Biomechanics, or similar)

About Stryker

Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.

The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.

More information is available at stryker.com

companyInfo/companyDescription: For more than five decades, our family-run company has earned a reputation for quality, integrity, and innovation. Growing from humble beginnings, our story began when Robert Bosa first emigrated from Italy to Vancouver alongside his family in the 1960s to start a small construction company. Today, we have the privilege of being one of Canada’s most respected, privately-owned companies, with a sterling reputation for excellence in design and construction.
descriptionHTML:
About The Company:

Bosa Properties Inc. (“BPI”) is an end-to-end real estate company offering human-centered solutions for property development and management. Based out of Vancouver, Canada, our team of in-house experts work across residential, commercial and master-planned projects, with a growing residential portfolio that includes more than 22,000 homes that are built or under development, and an income portfolio that includes 5.5 million square feet of retail, industrial, office and rental properties under management.

We are an organization of high achievers and believe what is created in community is always better than what is created in isolation. We set high expectations and support you in achieving excellence. We are building a trusted community to collaborate, learn from each other and deliver results.

About The Role:

Bosa Properties is looking for a Tax Intern to join our team of talented real estate professionals. Reporting to the Tax Manager, this individual will have a unique opportunity to play a supporting role in the tax compliance process and develop experience in the areas of indirect and corporate income tax.

What You'll Do
  • Provide support in the preparation of corporate income tax returns;
  • Prepare and file monthly GST returns;
  • Coordinate with internal and external parties at various stages of the tax compliance process;
  • Manage tax-related correspondence and communicate and coordinate with internal team members to address items requiring further action.
What You Bring:
  • Three (3) years of post-secondary education in Business, Accounting or Finance;
  • Strong attention to detail demonstrated through accuracy in data entry;
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in parallel;
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate intently and work collaboratively, building strong relationships across the organization and with external parties;
  • Prior internship experience within finance or accounting would be considered a strong asset;
  • Familiarity with or exposure to accounting systems from a previous internship, especially Yardi would be considered a strong asset.

Salary

The expected base salary for this role is $52,000.


Who You Are

  • Trustworthy: You lead with trust when interacting with your team and other departments. You proactively build trust by demonstrating credibility, empathy, and sincerity.
  • Humble: Unpretentious and self-aware, you take responsibility for your mistakes. You know that egos are barriers to doing our best work and always learning.
  • Community focused: You believe what is created in community is always better than what is created in isolation and excellence is created through collaboration.

How to Apply

We value your interest in Bosa Properties. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

You belong here! If your experience and interests match with some of the above, we want you to apply. We are dedicated to building a diverse community, where everyone belongs.

Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

#Li – Hybrid

description:
Job description
Seeking full-time or part-time Registered Clinical Counsellors or Canadian Certified Counsellors to provide counselling to individuals and couples. In this position, you are an independent contractor offering primarily in-person sessions with some virtual available.
About Us
Better Life Counselling & Therapy is a subsidiary of A Better Life Through Psychotherapy and Healing which was established in 1995 with the goal of providing accessible, effective counselling to individuals and families. Over the past 25 + years, we have successfully helped hundreds of families, parents, children and couples accomplish their goals of experiencing themselves as more connected, alive and free .
Our office is conveniently located off of the Brunette Exit.
Our Vision
We help thousands of people learn to live better lives with vitality and connection.
Our Core Values
Authenticity, Genuineness & Dignity
Be a Team Player
Work Hard, Play Hard
There are many different shifts available including: M-F 9am-3 pm; 3-9pm, weekends
The position is quite flexible and we can work with you to create a dream job!
By joining our team you will be provided with:

 Competitive compensation (based on experience)
 Referrals from a Waiting List
 Optional group and on-call peer consultation
 Optional professional development in Satir Family Systems with Master Trainer
 Professional office space
 Conveniently located just off Hwy #1/Brunette Ave

Qualifications

 The ideal candidate has a Masters degree and is Registered with the British Columbia Association of Clinical Counsellors or Canadian Counselling and Psychotherapy Association. You have or are planning to acquire EMDR training and approval from EMDRIA, Somatic Experiencing/ Attachment Psychotherapy and/or you have or are planning to acquire professional development training for working with couples (examples: Gottman, EFT, IFS for couples)

Application Process:

 Please send in your resume and cover letter to: betterlifecounsellingtherapy@gmail.com

For more info on our practice, check out our website: https://betterlifecounsellingtherapy.com

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Are you looking to develop your career and satisfy your ambitions at a company where you can aspire to new heights, enjoy personal growth and thrive on achievement? At Vanderlande, we are seeking passionate and ambitious people, capable of making a positive impact on our key customer projects, while developing a successful and prosperous career in a challenging and rewarding international environment.    

We are the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports – from London Heathrow to Singapore Changi – and in the parcel market, for main players such as UPS and FedEx. Furthermore, we are also a leading supplier of solutions for warehousing giants, including Amazon and Walmart, which seamlessly integrate innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services.
 
If you aspire to a position of responsibility – and want to make a difference by facilitating the delivery of what matters most to consumers, passengers and businesses – then the next step on your path to global opportunities is to join Vanderlande. As part of our network and unique culture of freedom and flexibility, you will be able to express yourself and become connected to our dedicated people, building strong relationships and rising to the challenge of industry-leading projects.

You will grow, take ownership and make every day better as you continue on the road to success with your spirit of adventure – and fulfil your ambitions for personal development through our Academy. Vanderlande will give you the necessary knowledge, tools and support, so that together we have the confidence and ability to exceed our customers’ expectations in over 100 countries. 

To achieve our collective goals, you will seize the initiative and have a hands-on role working in a positive environment to deliver tangible, state-of-the-art products and improve the competitiveness of our highly visible customers. As an integral part of our team, you will have the enthusiasm and be driven to reach our destination before your next journey with Vanderlande begins… 

So, if you would like to join a profitable and growing company that will enable you to reach your goals and focus on your future, then please contact us.
description:
Job Title
  Test/Integration Co-op Student
 
 
   Job Description
 
 
   Vanderlande Industries (
  
   www.vanderlande.com
  ) is a global company with headquarters in the Netherlands and a growing Canadian subsidiary head office located by the Vancouver International Airport in Richmond, BC.
 
 
   Vanderlande is the global market leader for value-added logistic process automation at airports, and in the parcel market. The company is also a leading supplier of process automation solutions for warehouses.
   
   Vanderlande's baggage handling systems move 3.7 billion pieces of luggage around the world per year, in other words 10.1 million per day. Its systems are active in 600 airports including 13 of the world's top 20. More than 39 million parcels are sorted by its systems every day, which have been installed for the world's leading parcel companies. In addition, many of the largest global e-commerce players and distribution firms have confidence in Vanderlande's efficient and reliable solutions.
   
   The company focuses on the optimization of its customers' business processes and competitive positions. Through close cooperation, it strives for the improvement of their operational activities and the expansion of their logistical achievements. Vanderlande's extensive portfolio of integrated solutions - innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services - results in the realization of fast, reliable and efficient automation technology. Being established worldwide, and having grown in sales in the Canadian market, we are looking for a top-notch Systems Integration Co-op student to join our expanding team in Richmond, BC.
 
 
   Responsibilities:
 
 
   Assist with integrated system testing and customer level testing.
   Assist in maintaining standardized documentation at integration and customer levels.
   Act as part of the deployment team, helping execute tests onsite.
   Identify and minimize (technical) risks.
   Reporting of the progress and status of the test execution.
   Understanding, interpreting and following procedures, standards and regulations.
   Communicating and working closely with other groups within Vanderlande and the project team (i.e., mechanical / controls engineering, project management, supply chain, sales/proposal department and installation).
   Advising the Engineering/Integration Manager of needed improvements for project execution and proposing technical solutions
 
 
   Qualifications:
 
 
   3rd or 4th year Systems Design, Mechatronics or Electrical Engineering student
   Experience with integration and configuration.
   Experience background in at least one relevant engineering discipline related to material handling.
   Must be able to obtain a security clearance pass
 
 
   
   Knowledge-Skills-Abilities:
 
 
   Strong interpersonal, leadership, verbal, and written skills; verifiable supervisory background.
   Self-motivated with proven ability in problem-solving skills under stressful conditions.
   Ability to deal with experienced, multidisciplinary, technical specialists.
   Ability to communicate effectively with subcontractors and office staff and solve problems.
   Strong team mentality and willingness to accept responsibility for project completion.
   Ability to effectively prioritize work/activities.
   Knowledgeable in project scheduling.
   Knowledgeable in electrical and controls engineering theories and principles; electrical aptitude and knowledge of acceptable practices, techniques, and codes.
   Ability to understand PLC programs (Allen-Bradley, Siemens, Modicon) SCADA systems (RSview, Wonderware, Allen-Bradley), Database applications, AutoCAD, MS Office suite and MS Project (or other scheduling software).

companyInfo/companyDescription: WhiteWater West is a manufacturing company based in Richmond, British Columbia, Canada. It was established in 1980 and manufactures a variety of products for water parks including water slides and water play areas. The company also owns Hopkins Rides and Prime Interactives which manufacture water rides for amusement parks and dry play areas, respectively.
description:
WhiteWater makes products, but we are a service business at our heart, which means we are a people business. In this way, we excel and create value for our clients by listening to their needs, collaborating to develop solutions, problem-solving and attending to the details. Our culture, as you would expect, reflects these traits. We are a diverse group of experts, from creative designers to talented engineers. Whatever expertise we bring from all over the world, we listen and learn from each other because we are aligned with a clearly understood purpose. Together, we create fun for families globally. 
 
  
 Are you interested in starting an exciting career with WhiteWater? Apply today!
 
  Whitewater's Engineering Services team is looking for a candidate to join our team in Richmond, BC in the following role:
 
  Position: Mechanical Engineering Intern Department: Engineering Services Location: Richmond, BC, Canada Reports to: Engineering Services Manager
 
  Purpose:
  
  
  WhiteWater West is seeking multiple Mechanical Engineering Interns to join our Engineering team at our Richmond head office for a 4-month term starting May 6, 2024 (possibility of an extension)! In this position, you will undertake a variety of tasks to assist the multi-disciplinary Engineering department. Examples of previous work assignments include: supporting Continuous Improvement efforts, creating design documentation, and occasional opportunities to assist in developing CAD models and evaluate design elements. The successful candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
 
  Essential Responsibilities:
  
  
  
  Review structural drawings to identify pre-engineered manufactured parts 
  Work with staff to transition existing designs from legacy systems into the PLM database for water slide parts, structural elements, product assemblies, and electrical/mechanical items 
  Analyze differences in worldwide materials standards and perform relevant calculations to propose standard substitutions 
  Mark up existing drawings to identify parts either already in PLM or needing to be set up in PLM and work with staff to set up such parts 
  Work within existing protocols for creation and file storage of all parts, assemblies, and drawings 
  Occasional maintenance and rework of existing parts, assemblies, and drawings to conform to current protocols 
  Occasional creation of CAD models, fabrication part drawings, assembly drawings, and Bills of Material (BOMs) for use by our manufacturers 
  Occasional assistance with analysis of structural design elements 
  Perform other duties as requested by the Design Manager
 
  
  
  Qualifications & Experience:
  
 
  
   Participating in post-secondary design education (prefer Mechanical Technologist, Mechanical Engineer, or Mechatronics student) 
  Proficient with CAD software, including AutoCAD and SolidWorks 
  Knowledge of drawings standards (ASME Y14.100) would be a definite asset 
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office 
  Must be legally eligible to work in Canada
 
  
  
  Competencies, Skills & Abilities:
  
  
  
  Curious with the desire to understand and a passion to learn 
  Ability to develop effective internal and external working relationships 
  Exceptional ability to listen, communicate (written and oral) and collaborate 
  Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-starter and energetic 
  Detail-oriented with critical thinking
 
  
  
  Whitewater Competencies:
  
 
  
   Accountability – We do what we say 
  Collaboration – We work well together 
  Customer Focus – We know and respond to our customers 
  Communication – We listen to and understand each other 
  Authenticity – We are honest and trust each other 
  Resilience – We deal effectively with pressure, are persistent and optimistic 
  Flexibility & Adaptability – We are willing and able to respond to changing circumstances
 
  
  
  WhiteWater is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the diversity of all employees and applicants and are strongly committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
  
  
  We thank all the candidates who take the time and energy to apply. Given the volume of applications, it makes responding personally to each applicant difficult, but please know we are grateful for your interest. We look forward to connecting with you through this search or future ones. All the best in your job search.

We thank all the candidates who take the time and energy to apply. Given the volume of applications, it makes responding personally to each applicant difficult, but please know we are grateful for your interest. We look forward to connecting with you through this search or future ones. All the best in your job search.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
As a global leader in commercial real estate services with 52,000 employees in over 400 offices and approximately 60 countries, 
we want to make the most of every opportunity for our clients—because our city, community, planet and future is what we make it 

Our values unite us: 
We are inclusive - We are a global company shaping diverse communities, inclusivity goes beyond an ethos into everyday action. 
We are driven - With a united belief that ‘life is what we make it’, we can be more driven, more agile and we can be ourselves. 
We are collaborative - We are a global network of people who are able to make some pretty amazing things happen, because we do it together. 
We are insightful - We are a company built by over 100 years of digging deeper for insights, ideas, opportunities and innovation.
