companyInfo/companyDescription:
COWI is a leading consulting group that creates value for customers, people and society through our unique 360° approach. Based on our world-class competencies within engineering, economics and environmental science, we tackle challenges from many vantage points to create coherent solutions for our customer.
With offices across the globe, we combine global presence with local knowledge to take on projects anywhere in the world - no matter how large or small. At any given moment, we are involved in more than 12,000 projects.

At COWI, we take pride in employees who are curious about new technologies and ways to cooperate to deliver future-oriented solutions to our customers. And we believe that you develop best by participating in projects that challenge your knowledge.

We cooperate across disciplines, customer portfolios and business units all over the world. As an employee in COWI, an international career is within your reach. By working on our global projects, you can develop sustainable solutions from Africa to Europe and from Asia to America.

We have nearly 90 years of experience in the business, and COWI is a leader within its field because our 7,300 employees are leaders within theirs. Together, we create coherence in tomorrow's sustainable societies.

Join us and expand your potential!
description:
Application deadline: 23 March 2024 - Canada - Location: North Vancouver, BC - Infrastructure & Transportation 
 
  Stagiaire en ingénieurie ponts et ouvrages d'art 
  North Vancouver
   Temporaire
   Voulez-vous faire partie d'une équipe d’experts internationale et travailler sous la supervision d'un ingénieur professionnel? Pouvez-vous aider une équipe hautement professionnelle qui fournit des services de génie-conseil, de gestion de projet, d’ingénierie détaillée et de suivi de construction sur de nombreux projets de conception de ponts complexes? Si c'est le cas, c'est votre chance de convertir vos aspirations en actions.
   Transformer les défis en solutions durables
   Nous sommes à la recherche d’un stagiaire en ingénierie en ponts et ouvrages d'art pour joindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec une équipe d’experts aux côtés de nos clients sur certains projets des plus importants d'Amérique du Nord. Avec nos clients, partenaires et collègues, nous façonnons un avenir où les personnes et les sociétés grandissent et s’épanouissent. Pour ce faire, nous co-créons des solutions durables et esthétiques qui améliorent la qualité de vie des gens d’aujourd’hui et des générations à venir.
   Vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :
  
   
     Aider à préparer des plans et autres documents d’ingénierie en français
   
   
     Effectuer des inspections de ponts et autres structures
   
   
     Aider à préparer des rapports d’inspection et autres documents techniques
   
   
     Appliquer des articles de code de conception aux tâches d’ingénierie assignées sous supervision
   
   
     Communiquer efficacement et professionnellement avec les membres de l’équipe
   
   
     Assister aux réunions de projet et fournir une mise à jour sur les tâches assignées
   
  
   Vos compétences. Notre équipe. Ensemble, nous concevons l’avenir
   La première étape vers le succès dans ce rôle est d’être désireux de collaborer avec les personnes qui vous entourent. Développer des liens avec les autres est quelque chose que vous faites en agissant avec respect et en tenant vos engagements. Et vous ne restez pas ancré dans vos habitudes, mais continuez à explorer de nouvelles idées et de nouvelles façons de vous améliorer.
   En plus de cela, vous êtes:
  
   
     Vous maîtrisez le français et l’anglais
   
   
     Vous être inscrit(e)s dans un programme d’ingénierie civil ou en structure et vous avez complété au moins les deux premières années du programme
   
   
     Vous êtes disponibles pour un stage d’au moins huit mois
   
   
     Vous avez une bonne connaissance des logiciels d’ingénierie tels qu’Excel pour produire efficacement des calculs d’ingénierie
   
   
     Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en communication interpersonnelle, verbale et écrite
   
   
     Titulaire d'un permis de conduire de classe 5
   
   
     Vous pouvez et vous avez la volonté de voyager pour mener des inspections qui peuvent durer une semaine ou plus
   
  
   SVP veuillez déposer votre candidature en anglais.
   Encore des questions?
   Si vous avez des questions sans réponse sur le rôle ou ce que nous avons à offrir, veuillez contacter l’administrateur de l’acquisition de talents Mehul Jain à l’adresse MHJI@COWI.COM.
   Apprenez à mieux nous connaître sur notre site internet, www.cowi.com , où vous pouvez en apprendre davantage sur nos projets, notre stratégie, ce que nous voulons réaliser et à quoi ressemble la vie chez COWI.
   Employeur de l’égalité d’accès
   COWI offre l'égalité de l'accès à l’emploi (EAE) à tous les employés et candidats à l’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’origine, l’âge, le handicap ou la génétique. En plus des exigences de la loi fédérale, COWI se conforme aux lois fédérales et locales applicables régissant la non-discrimination dans l’emploi partout où l’entreprise a des installations. Cette pratique s’applique à toutes les conditions d’emploi, y compris le recrutement, l’embauche, le placement, la promotion, la cessation d’emploi, la mise à pied, le rappel, la mutation, les congés, la rémunération et la formation.
   Bridge Intern 
  North Vancouver
   Temporary
   Do you want to join a global team of experts and work under the guidance of professional engineers? Can you assist a highly professional team that provides consulting, project management, and design and construction engineering services on numerous complex bridge design projects? Then, here is your chance to convert aspirations into actions.
   Turn challenges into sustainable solutions
   We are looking for a Bridge Intern to join our team. You will work closely with a team of experts working alongside our customers on some of North America's most significant projects. Together with customers, partners, and colleagues, we shape a future where people and societies grow and flourish. We do that by co-creating sustainable and beautiful solutions that improve the quality of life for people today and many generations ahead.
   
  Your key responsibilities will be to: 
  
   
    Assist in preparing drawings and other engineering documents in French
   
   
     Perform inspections of bridges and other structures
   
   
     Assist in preparing inspection reports and other technical documents
   
   
     Apply design code clauses to engineering tasks assigned under supervision
   
   
     Communicate effectively and professionally with team members
   
   
     Attend project meetings and provide updates on assigned tasks
   
  
   Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future
   The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.
   On top of that, you will:
  
   
     Have fluency in both French and English
   
   
     Be enrolled in Civil or Structural Engineering and have completed at least two years in the program
   
   
     Be available for an 8 month work term
   
   
     Be conversant in the use of engineering software such as Excel to efficiently produce engineering calculations
   
   
     Have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
   
   
     Possess a Class 5 driver's licence
   
   
     Have the ability and willingness to go on inspection trips that may have a duration of one week or more
   
  
   Got more questions?
   If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Administrator Mehul at mhji@COWI.COM.
   Base compensation: $49,000 to $67,000 for North Vancouver location only. Actual compensation is subject to variations due to education, experience, skill set and/or location
   Equal opportunity employer
   COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

   #LI-MHJI
descriptionHTML:
Application deadline: 23 March 2024 - Canada - Location: North Vancouver, BC - Infrastructure & Transportation

Stagiaire en ingénieurie ponts et ouvrages d'art

North Vancouver

Temporaire

Voulez-vous faire partie d'une équipe d’experts internationale et travailler sous la supervision d'un ingénieur professionnel? Pouvez-vous aider une équipe hautement professionnelle qui fournit des services de génie-conseil, de gestion de projet, d’ingénierie détaillée et de suivi de construction sur de nombreux projets de conception de ponts complexes? Si c'est le cas, c'est votre chance de convertir vos aspirations en actions.

Transformer les défis en solutions durables

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un stagiaire en ingénierie en ponts et ouvrages d'art pour joindre notre équipe. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec une équipe d’experts aux côtés de nos clients sur certains projets des plus importants d'Amérique du Nord. Avec nos clients, partenaires et collègues, nous façonnons un avenir où les personnes et les sociétés grandissent et s’épanouissent. Pour ce faire, nous co-créons des solutions durables et esthétiques qui améliorent la qualité de vie des gens d’aujourd’hui et des générations à venir.

Vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :

    Aider à préparer des plans et autres documents d’ingénierie en français
    Effectuer des inspections de ponts et autres structures
    Aider à préparer des rapports d’inspection et autres documents techniques
    Appliquer des articles de code de conception aux tâches d’ingénierie assignées sous supervision
    Communiquer efficacement et professionnellement avec les membres de l’équipe
    Assister aux réunions de projet et fournir une mise à jour sur les tâches assignées

Vos compétences. Notre équipe. Ensemble, nous concevons l’avenir

La première étape vers le succès dans ce rôle est d’être désireux de collaborer avec les personnes qui vous entourent. Développer des liens avec les autres est quelque chose que vous faites en agissant avec respect et en tenant vos engagements. Et vous ne restez pas ancré dans vos habitudes, mais continuez à explorer de nouvelles idées et de nouvelles façons de vous améliorer.

En plus de cela, vous êtes:

    Vous maîtrisez le français et l’anglais
    Vous être inscrit(e)s dans un programme d’ingénierie civil ou en structure et vous avez complété au moins les deux premières années du programme
    Vous êtes disponibles pour un stage d’au moins huit mois
    Vous avez une bonne connaissance des logiciels d’ingénierie tels qu’Excel pour produire efficacement des calculs d’ingénierie
    Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en communication interpersonnelle, verbale et écrite
    Titulaire d'un permis de conduire de classe 5
    Vous pouvez et vous avez la volonté de voyager pour mener des inspections qui peuvent durer une semaine ou plus

SVP veuillez déposer votre candidature en anglais.

Encore des questions?

Si vous avez des questions sans réponse sur le rôle ou ce que nous avons à offrir, veuillez contacter l’administrateur de l’acquisition de talents Mehul Jain à l’adresse MHJI@COWI.COM.

Apprenez à mieux nous connaître sur notre site internet, www.cowi.com , où vous pouvez en apprendre davantage sur nos projets, notre stratégie, ce que nous voulons réaliser et à quoi ressemble la vie chez COWI.

Employeur de l’égalité d’accès

COWI offre l'égalité de l'accès à l’emploi (EAE) à tous les employés et candidats à l’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’origine, l’âge, le handicap ou la génétique. En plus des exigences de la loi fédérale, COWI se conforme aux lois fédérales et locales applicables régissant la non-discrimination dans l’emploi partout où l’entreprise a des installations. Cette pratique s’applique à toutes les conditions d’emploi, y compris le recrutement, l’embauche, le placement, la promotion, la cessation d’emploi, la mise à pied, le rappel, la mutation, les congés, la rémunération et la formation.

Bridge Intern

North Vancouver

Temporary

Do you want to join a global team of experts and work under the guidance of professional engineers? Then, here is your chance to convert aspirations into actions.

Turn challenges into sustainable solutions

We do that by co-creating sustainable and beautiful solutions that improve the quality of life for people today and many generations ahead.

    Assist in preparing drawings and other engineering documents in French
    Perform inspections of bridges and other structures
    Assist in preparing inspection reports and other technical documents
    Apply design code clauses to engineering tasks assigned under supervision

Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future


The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.

On top of that, you will:

    Have fluency in both French and English
    Be enrolled in Civil or Structural Engineering and have completed at least two years in the program
    Be available for an 8 month work term
    Be conversant in the use of engineering software such as Excel to efficiently produce engineering calculations
    Have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
    Possess a Class 5 driver's licence
    Have the ability and willingness to go on inspection trips that may have a duration of one week or more

Got more questions?

If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Administrator Mehul at mhji@COWI.COM.


Base compensation: $49,000 to $67,000 for North Vancouver location only. Actual compensation is subject to variations due to education, experience, skill set and/or location

companyInfo/companyDescription:
In 1980, Liz and Dick Uihlein recognized a local need for a shipping supply distributor and started Uline from their basement. Their first product was the H-101 carton sizer (still offered today). From those humble beginnings, the business has grown far beyond their expectations, while still remaining a family-owned and run company.

Uline is now North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies with over 1,700 box sizes in stock. Product lines have expanded to include retail, safety, material handling and janitorial items. Uline's 848-page catalog reaches businesses nationwide, offering 40,000 products always in stock for quick delivery.

With over 8,500 employees in North America, Uline has distribution centers near Chicago, IL; Minneapolis, MN; Allentown, PA; Los AngelUline has distribution centers near Chicago, IL; Minneapolis, MN; Allentown, PA; Los Angeles, CA; Atlanta, GA; Dallas, TX; Reno, NV and Seattle, WA, as well as international locations near Toronto and Edmonton, Canada and in Mexicali and Monterrey, Mexico.

Uline is a drug-free workplace.
description:
Outside Sales Internship 
  Paid Internship - Summer 2024 
  
  Vancouver, British Columbia 
  $26 per hour 
  
  Are you a university student looking to launch your sales career? Then you belong at Uline! As an Outside Sales Intern, you’ll spend your summer working side-by-side with an incredible team supported by the best training, tools and products to win in the field every day. Uline continues to grow, creating new career opportunities and job stability you can count on. It’s an exciting time to join Uline! 
  
  Why Sales this Summer at Uline? 
 
 
  
   Gain hands-on, real-world experience in this face-to-face selling position that allows you to be an active, outside sales associate. 
   Work in a high-energy, fast-paced environment that’s both competitive and fun. 
   Take part in two weeks of professional sales training to sharpen your presentation skills and product knowledge. 
   Meet weekly with a dedicated sales mentor who will guide and support you on sales calls. 
   Learn more about our industry with weekly coaching from leadership. 
   Receive a mileage reimbursement. 
   Earn competitive pay over summer and the potential opportunity to work with us full-time upon graduation. 
  
  
  Position Responsibilities 
  
   Deliver next-level customer service and support sales growth in accounts across all industries within your territory. 
   Coordinate and complete over 250+ one-on-one customer visits providing business solutions from our catalog stacked with over 40,000 quality products. 
   Attend weekly sales staff meetings. 
  
  
  Minimum Requirements 
  
   This full-time, 17-week internship is open to 3rd and 4th-year students only. 
   Clear, professional communication and presentation skills. Hardworking and enthusiastic with a “team player” attitude. 
  
  
  About Uline 
  
  Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 9,000 employees across 13 branch locations and 15 sales offices, it's time you joined Uline. 
  
  Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace. 
  
  Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer 
  
  #LI-MA2 
  (#IN-EDMIN) 
 
 
 Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore https://www.uline.jobs/#working-here_blankUline.jobs to learn more!

description:
LCBN Administrative Assistant
Latin-Canadian Business Network (LCBN), is a program that fosters the growth of the Latin American community and increases its presence both economically and socially.
Serving as a platform for entrepreneurs, experienced professionals, job seekers, newcomers, and medium and large companies, LCBN brings these diverse groups together and facilitates the exchange of knowledge, opportunities, and network expansion.
Job Description
Build and manage the relationships with the business partners of the LCBN Program to mutually benefit all the parties involved: membership, sponsors and organization allies, to the growth and capitalization of Latincouver in terms of revenue and expanding social impact.
Job Responsibilities 

 Assist in the creation, organization and management of LCBN Program materials, including thank you letters, collateral, visual assets, eNewsletter, proposals, presentations and sales microsites.
 Support requesting a marketing and communication team for administrative follow-up of business partnership activities.
 Manage commercial inquiries, including assistance with vetting & tracking inquiries, sending correspondence, sharing potential opportunities and directing requests to appropriate contacts.
 Manage the organization database helping to maintain accurate, up-to-date records and generate reports to keep team members on track with monthly goals and target numbers.
 Conduct market research on a variety of topics including new service categories, prospective business partners, key contacts, competition, etc.
 Build and preserve a long-term relationship with Business Partners.
 Attend and/or support Latincouver events and conferences to build new business partners for the memberships the, including prep, onsite support and other related duties.
 Fulfilling requests and media decks, for key influencers and potential business partners.
 Creation and editing of agreements, documents, and templates.
 Organize and attend weekly team meetings, including follow-up of agendas.
 Collaborate with the team on new ideas and work with colleagues across the organization.

It is important to note that as a volunteer, your duties may be flexible and can vary based on the organization's needs. You should communicate with your supervisor to understand their specific expectations and goals for your role.
Qualifications: 

 Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, sales, or a related field.
 Sales/Customer Service experience of minimum 2 years in any field.
 Strong attention to detail.
 Good communication skills at all levels, both written and oral.
 Competent in the use of Google Workspace.
 Experience organizing data and creating presentations.

Requirements and Skills:

 Communication
 Problem-solving
 Proactive
 Self-organized
 Detail-oriented
 Desirable: Competent in the use of Slack, ClickUp and Canva

Benefits to volunteering with us:

 Free participation in different events
 Build your skills and connect with Others
 Gain Professional Experience in Canada
 Reference letter for one month of commitment
 Certificate of appreciation
 Increasing your networking
 Making new friends
 Valuable knowledge about the Canadian labour market
 Being part of a fun multicultural team

Latincouver Cultural & Business Society fosters an equitable workplace and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage all qualified people to apply.
Job Types: Part-time, Volunteer
Salary: $0.01 per hour
Expected hours: No less than 12 per week
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Company events
 Flexible schedule
 Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Education:

 Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Language:

 English (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Vancouver, BC

description:
Job Title: Hardware Engineer (Co-op) 
   Term/Duration: 8 Month Term, Full Time (40 hours per week) 
   
   Location: Arlo Canada 
    200-10851 Shellbridge Way 
    Richmond, BC. 
    Canada. V6X 2W8 
   
  Job Description 
   Arlo Canada division is looking for students with a strong interest and knowledge in wireless data communication hardware development. As a part of the Hardware team, you will gain hands-on experience working on prototype to mass production life cycle development, exposure to a wide variety of test equipment and an introduction to BLE/WiFi technologies. Specifically, you will be responsible for the design of new IoT products on the world’s largest wireless networks. 
   Responsibilities 
   - Test and design baseband circuits involving switching power supplies, battery charging systems, power consumption test 
   - Follow design verification test plans and document reports for wireless devices 
   - Assist with assembly, rework and debug of various wireless products 
   Qualifications 
   - Experience with wireless products (BLE/WiFi) is a strong asset 
   - Strong written and oral communication skills 
   - Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment 
   - Software development, programming and/or scripting experience is preferred 
  We thank all applicants for their interest in this position but only candidates for consideration will be contacted. 
  
    Studies have shown that candidates from certain underrepresented communities may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job, regardless of their background. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described. We may work with candidates, as appropriate, to ensure they develop additional skills as necessary to fulfil the essential functions of the job.
  
   
   
  
    Arlo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to a diverse, inclusive, and harassment-free workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on Indigenous identity, race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or age, or any other legally protected status in all hiring and employment. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees as required by law. Where required by applicable provincial law, the Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal charges or convictions.
  
   
   
  
    The pay range for this position reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries at commencement of employment and is expected to be between CAD$3,100/month. However, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors, including role, job-related knowledge, skills, relevant education and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including bonus, equity, and a full range of benefits. Details of all benefits will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
À PROPOS DE FPINNOVATIONS 

FPInnovations est un organisme sans but lucratif qui se spécialise dans la création de solutions afin de soutenir la compétitivité du secteur forestier canadien à l’échelle mondiale. L’organisme jouit d’une position idéale pour effectuer de la recherche de pointe, concevoir des technologies avancées et offrir des solutions novatrices à des problèmes complexes, et ce, à chaque élément de la chaîne des valeurs du secteur, des opérations forestières aux produits industriels et de consommation.

 
ABOUT FPINNOVATIONS

FPInnovations is a private not-for-profit organization that specializes in the creation of solutions in support of the Canadian forest sector’s global competitiveness. It is ideally positioned to perform state-of-the-art research, develop advanced technologies, and deliver innovative solutions to complex problems for every area of the sector’s value chain, from forest operations to consumer and industrial products.
description:
At FPInnovations, we don't just offer jobs, we offer career opportunities that will allow you to significantly contribute to the Canadian forest industry. We rely on the outstanding expertise of over 330 employees to support our member companies and the industry.
        
        
        
          You can look forward to:
        
        
          An organization in the midst of a transformation that focuses on agility and innovation
          Working with dedicated and passionate people
          Support in achieving your professional goals
          Hybrid telework policy when possible
          Monday to Friday work week with flexible scheduling options (may require travel on weekends)
        
        
        
          DESCRIPTION
        
        
          Come join a team of operational wildfire researchers and make a difference delivering practical solutions for living well with wildfire. Our wildfire operations research program applies sound scientific methods to create impacts for wildfire agencies along the research themes of mitigation and prevention, wildfire response, post-fire response and recovery and national wildfire data collection. We are looking for a team player that has a keen aptitude for learning and an interest in applying their passion for research.
        
        
        
          RESPONSIBILITIES
        
        
          Support Wildfire Operations Researchers both in the office and the field
          Assist in the collection, organization and presentation of data
          Review, disseminate, and present wildfire literature in both written and presentation formats
          Collaborate with other FPInnovations teams and work groups, including Indigenous Programs and Forest Operations
          Develop an advanced understanding of wildfire behavior and the wildfire environment
          Adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
        
        
        
          Work locations: Vancouver or Kamloops, BC or Edmonton, AB; we will consider other locations.
        
        
        
          QUALIFICATIONS
        
        
          Be registered in 3rd year or higher of a Bachelor’s degree (University undergraduate) in Forestry Operations, Natural Resources, Environmental Studies, or equivalent
          Applicable wildfire experience
          Hold a valid Class 5 Alberta or British Columbia Driver’s license, with clean driving record and have access to a vehicle
          Worksafe certification is an asset
        
        
          SKILLS
        
        
          Team player, curious and focused on improving the forest industry
          Resilience, adaptability to changing priorities; our research is often weather dependent, which requires us to respond quickly to rapidly changing environments and circumstances
          Positive attitude and open to learning
          Self-motivation and strong organizational skills
          Experience with field data collection would be considered an asset
          Fluency in English, (spoken and written-scientific writing), French an asset
        
        
         FPInnovations is committed to the principle of equal access to employment.
descriptionHTML:
At FPInnovations, we don't just offer jobs, we offer career opportunities that will allow you to significantly contribute to the Canadian forest industry. We rely on the outstanding expertise of over 330 employees to support our member companies and the industry.

You can look forward to:
  • An organization in the midst of a transformation that focuses on agility and innovation
  • Working with dedicated and passionate people
  • Support in achieving your professional goals
  • Hybrid telework policy when possible
  • Monday to Friday work week with flexible scheduling options (may require travel on weekends)

DESCRIPTION
Come join a team of operational wildfire researchers and make a difference delivering practical solutions for living well with wildfire. Our wildfire operations research program applies sound scientific methods to create impacts for wildfire agencies along the research themes of mitigation and prevention, wildfire response, post-fire response and recovery and national wildfire data collection. We are looking for a team player that has a keen aptitude for learning and an interest in applying their passion for research.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Support Wildfire Operations Researchers both in the office and the field
  • Assist in the collection, organization and presentation of data
  • Review, disseminate, and present wildfire literature in both written and presentation formats
  • Collaborate with other FPInnovations teams and work groups, including Indigenous Programs and Forest Operations
  • Develop an advanced understanding of wildfire behavior and the wildfire environment
  • Adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures

Work locations: Vancouver or Kamloops, BC or Edmonton, AB; we will consider other locations.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Be registered in 3rd year or higher of a Bachelor’s degree (University undergraduate) in Forestry Operations, Natural Resources, Environmental Studies, or equivalent
  • Applicable wildfire experience
  • Hold a valid Class 5 Alberta or British Columbia Driver’s license, with clean driving record and have access to a vehicle
  • Worksafe certification is an asset

SKILLS
  • Team player, curious and focused on improving the forest industry
  • Resilience, adaptability to changing priorities; our research is often weather dependent, which requires us to respond quickly to rapidly changing environments and circumstances
  • Positive attitude and open to learning
  • Self-motivation and strong organizational skills
  • Experience with field data collection would be considered an asset
  • Fluency in English, (spoken and written-scientific writing), French an asset


FPInnovations is committed to the principle of equal access to employment.

companyInfo/companyDescription: BBA has been providing a wide range of consulting engineering services for over 40 years. Today, its engineering, environmental and commissioning experts team up to quickly and accurately pinpoint the needs of industrial and institutional clients. The firm’s expertise is recognized in the Energy and Natural Resources industry. With 15 offices in Canada and internationally (Chile), offering clients local support and field presence, BBA is recognized for providing some of the industry’s most innovative, sustainable and reliable engineering solutions.
description:
Type of position: Trainee
 
   Your future role on our team
   
   Your role as a Civil Engineering Co-op student will be to take part in engineering projects. You will also be responsible for ensuring the quality of professional services provided and maintaining good working relationships.
 
 
    With us, you’ll get the opportunity to...
 
 
   Participate in small to major projects for industrial, hydropower, mining and metals, and municipal clients.
   Perform calculations, both manually and with specialized software. 
  Apply calculation results and design methods. 
  Participate in preparing sketches and drawings. 
  Participate in preparing reports, specifications and tenders. 
  Participate in client site visits, coordinate project deliverables and support senior P.Engs. in their project work. 
  Check work for accuracy and conformity.
 
  Do your qualities and values match our corporate culture?
 
   Client-oriented
   Proactive, takes initiative and possesses creative and innovative problem-solving skills 
  Adaptable to various environments and situations 
  Comfortable working independently and within a team
   High capacity to learn on projects
 
  Overview of certifications and job requirements
  
 
   Enrolled in a Civil Engineering program
   Good academic grades 
  Excellent communication skills in English 
  Asset: Ability to communicate in French
 
 
  Compensation Overview
 
   Hourly Wage $ 23.93 - $30.19
 
  BBA considers various factors to determine the annual base salary such as, but no limited to: Education, relevant and demonstrated work experience about the position , skills, geographic location, qualifications, certifications, and other relevant competencies.
 
  At BBA you get many benefits
 
   A vibrant social club with something for everyone 
   Access to many experts and coaching 
   A collaborative team that shares its ideas and knowledge 
   Opportunity for site work: an amazing career accelerator! 
   Participation in our firm’s major projects up to 2030: 
   
    BBA’s carbon neutrality
    30% of women on our team
    and much more!
   
   Custom training and development plans
 
 
  About BBA For over 40 years, we’ve been pushing the boundaries of engineering to serve our clients in the Energy and Natural Resources sector. At BBA, we develop innovative, flexible and sustainable solutions, from strategy to execution.  BBA is one of Canada’s leading private consulting engineering firms, focused on practice (PCB), with a network of 18 offices. Our teams work closely to deliver projects that shape tomorrow’s industry at the local, national and international levels. Our people’s passion and excellence make BBA a Canada’s Best Employer and one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.  We have unique talents, and we’re committed to providing a workplace where you can be yourself. Job postings are written in gender-neutral language.  Learn more about us by visiting our LinkedIn page and join the networks of our talent attraction specialists to speak with them directly.

About BBA
For over 40 years, we’ve been pushing the boundaries of engineering to serve our clients in the Energy and Natural Resources sector. At BBA, we develop innovative, flexible and sustainable solutions, from strategy to execution.
BBA is one of Canada’s leading private consulting engineering firms, focused on practice (PCB), with a network of 18 offices. Our teams work closely to deliver projects that shape tomorrow’s industry at the local, national and international levels.
Our people’s passion and excellence make BBA a Canada’s Best Employer and one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.
We have unique talents, and we’re committed to providing a workplace where you can be yourself. Job postings are written in gender-neutral language.
Learn more about us by visiting our LinkedIn page and join the networks of our talent attraction specialists to speak with them directly.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
DataVisor is a startup that provides big data security analytics for consumer-facing websites and apps. The DataVisor solution works in real-time and leverages cloud computing to meet the needs of the largest Internet sites in the world. It is proven and deployed in full production with several marquee brands today. 

The company is founded by two world-renowned experts in Internet security with extensive experience protecting consumer-facing services, and is backed by NEA, the largest venture capital firm by assets under management. DataVisor is in stealth mode and is based in Silicon Valley.
description:
DataVisor is the world’s leading AI-powered Fraud and Risk Platform that delivers the best overall detection coverage in industry. With an open SaaS platform that supports easy consolidation and enrichment of any data, DataVisor's solution scales infinitely and enables organizations to act on fast-evolving fraud and money laundering activities in real time. Its patented unsupervised machine learning technology, advanced device intelligence, powerful decision engine and investigation tools work together to provide guaranteed performance lift from day one. DataVisor's platform is architected to support multiple use cases across different business units flexibly, dramatically lowering total cost of ownership, compared to legacy point solutions. DataVisor is recognized as an industry leader and has been adopted by many Fortune 500 companies across the globe.
  Our award-winning software platform is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, machine learning, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us!
 
  Responsibilities:
  
  Work under the direction of mentors to test state-of-the-art product 
  Design and develop robust automated test scripts based on the QA team's manual test cases. 
  Implement UI tests using selenium to ensure our applications' user interface meets our quality standards. 
  Develop API tests to validate the functionality, reliability, performance, and security of our APIs using tools like Postman, Cucumber etc.. 
  Work closely with the QA team to understand the test requirements and convert manual test cases into automated scripts. 
  Continuously improve and expand our automation test framework to enhance test execution speed, scalability, and reliability. 
  Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs through to resolution. 
  Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies, and integrate them into the test process where beneficial. 
  Provide detailed reports and metrics on test execution, coverage, and areas for improvement to the QA and development teams. 
 
 Requirements
  
  Current college student majoring in Computer Science or a related field. 
  One year of hands-on experience with Java or JavaScript. 
  Strong work ethic and commitment to producing high-quality results. 
  Excellent communication and analytical skills. 
 
 
 Benefits
  
  Hands-on experience in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. 
  Opportunity to work closely with experienced professionals in the field. 
  Exposure to real-world software testing scenarios. 
  Competitive hourly rate

companyInfo/companyDescription:
BrandSafway is a leading global provider of access, specialized services, and forming and shoring solutions to the industrial, commercial and infrastructure markets.

We deliver more value by helping customers improve productivity and safety on every jobsite.
description:
Engineering Internship 
 Summary 
 Title: Engineering Internship 
 ID: 2955304 
 Location: Vancouver, BC (Canada) 
 Job Function : Intern 
 Description 
 BrandSafway is committed to inspiring the next generation to pursue careers in infrastructure, construction, engineering, and corporate functions through our 2024 Summer Internship Program . If you are interested in an opportunity to gain hands-on experience with an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to discover your passion while building your career and personal brand, you’ve come to the right place! 
 
  You will engage and partner on innovative projects to gain experience in a fast paced, cross functional team environment 
   You will receive mentor support for your professional development 
   Yo will network and learn about other functions from leaders at BrandSafway through virtual lunch & learns 
  
 We are looking for an Engineering Intern based in Vancouver, BC, Canada . This internship will run from May 20, 2024 – August 2, 2024 and is open to Undergrad students. 
 A leading provider of specialized services to the global industrial, commercial and infrastructure markets, BrandSafway delivers access and scaffolding systems, forming and shoring, industrial services and related solutions to more than 32,000 customers worldwide. BrandSafway was formed when Brand Energy & Infrastructure Services and Safway Group combined in 2017. We are a corporation of 45,000 employees with operations in more than 35 countries. 
 At BrandSafway, we know our employees are our greatest asset, which is why we give them the tools, training and resources to be successful. Come join our growing team! 
 GENERAL SUMMARY : 
 
  Forming and Shoring Documentation 
   Joint project to update Engineering Design Calculations to newest codes and create applicable document versions for countries based on code differences 
   Rebrand legacy documents 
   Provide new documents based on historic demand and document gaps 
   Product design file transition 
   Provide design file migration to new platform 
   Where necessary design fabrication drawings based on 2d pdf’s 
   Develop Revit families off fabrication files as needed 
  
 What You Need To Succeed : 
 
  Technical Document Writer 
   Ability to modify existing documents as well as create new ones utilizing Adobe in-design in alignment with documentation standards 
   Mechanical or Civil Engineer 
   Ability to interpret industry codes 
   Research applicable codes based on location 
   Interpret and calculation product part capacities based on material and structural properties 
   Engineering Technician 
   Ability to use Solidworks, Inventor and AutoCAD 
   Strong inventor skills a must 
   Organizational skills and potentially experience with Autodesk Vault 
   Enrolled in college/university in degree noted under “Required Skills” 
   Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Masters or Under grad degree in Engineering. 
   Ability to participate in a full time internship between May 20, 2024 – August 2, 2024 
  
 BrandSafway, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, age, disability, special disabled or Vietnam or other era veteran status. 
 Notice to all potential job candidates: 
 Please be advised that BrandSafway will never require or ask for any fee from you in exchange for being considered, hired, promoted, transferred or having ongoing employment with us. It is a violation of our Code of Conduct if any employee requests any money or fee from you in exchange for tentatively special treatment or consideration. If anyone, regardless of whether an existing employee, or anyone else, requests payment of any fee in exchange for being hired into our company, you may confidentially contact our HR Compliance department at hrcompliance@brandsafway.com and provide the name of the individual and any other documentation or proof of such an act. 
 #2024Internship

Engineering Internship

Summary

Title: Engineering Internship

ID: 2955304

Location: Vancouver, BC (Canada)

Job Function : Intern

Description

BrandSafway is committed to inspiring the next generation to pursue careers in infrastructure, construction, engineering, and corporate functions through our 2024 Summer Internship Program . If you are interested in an opportunity to gain hands-on experience with an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to discover your passion while building your career and personal brand, you’ve come to the right place!

  • You will engage and partner on innovative projects to gain experience in a fast paced, cross functional team environment

We are looking for an Engineering Intern based in Vancouver, BC, Canada . This internship will run from May 20, 2024 – August 2, 2024 and is open to Undergrad students.

A leading provider of specialized services to the global industrial, commercial and infrastructure markets, BrandSafway delivers access and scaffolding systems, forming and shoring, industrial services and related solutions to more than 32,000 customers worldwide. BrandSafway was formed when Brand Energy & Infrastructure Services and Safway Group combined in 2017. We are a corporation of 45,000 employees with operations in more than 35 countries.

At BrandSafway, we know our employees are our greatest asset, which is why we give them the tools, training and resources to be successful. Come join our growing team!

GENERAL SUMMARY :

  • Forming and Shoring Documentation

  • Joint project to update Engineering Design Calculations to newest codes and create applicable document versions for countries based on code differences

  • Rebrand legacy documents

  • Provide design file migration to new platform

  • Where necessary design fabrication drawings based on 2d pdf’s

BrandSafway, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, national origin, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, age, disability, special disabled or Vietnam or other era veteran status.

Notice to all potential job candidates:

Please be advised that BrandSafway will never require or ask for any fee from you in exchange for being considered, hired, promoted, transferred or having ongoing employment with us. It is a violation of our Code of Conduct if any employee requests any money or fee from you in exchange for tentatively special treatment or consideration. If anyone, regardless of whether an existing employee, or anyone else, requests payment of any fee in exchange for being hired into our company, you may confidentially contact our HR Compliance department at hrcompliance@brandsafway.com and provide the name of the individual and any other documentation or proof of such an act.

#2024Internship

companyInfo/companyDescription: For more than five decades, our family-run company has earned a reputation for quality, integrity, and innovation. Growing from humble beginnings, our story began when Robert Bosa first emigrated from Italy to Vancouver alongside his family in the 1960s to start a small construction company. Today, we have the privilege of being one of Canada’s most respected, privately-owned companies, with a sterling reputation for excellence in design and construction.
descriptionHTML:
About The Company:

Bosa Properties Inc. (“BPI”) is an end-to-end real estate company offering human-centered solutions for property development and management. Based out of Vancouver, Canada, our team of in-house experts work across residential, commercial and master-planned projects, with a growing residential portfolio that includes more than 22,000 homes that are built or under development, and an income portfolio that includes 5.5 million square feet of retail, industrial, office and rental properties under management.

We are an organization of high achievers and believe what is created in community is always better than what is created in isolation. We set high expectations and support you in achieving excellence. We are building a trusted community to collaborate, learn from each other and deliver results.

About The Role:

Bosa Properties is looking for an Accounting Intern to join our team of talented real estate professionals. Reporting to the Accounts Payable Manager, this individual will have a unique opportunity to learn about the various business operations of a growing real estate firm.


What You'll Do

  • Perform data entry and verify invoices related to multiple operating entities;
  • Reconcile vendor accounts;
  • Set up new vendors in the accounting system;
  • Lead communications to enroll vendors for electronic payments and electronic invoicing;
  • Assist with corporate expense reconciliations and other ad hoc projects as required;
  • Provide support for the annual Property Tax payment and Speculation Tax filing process.
What You Bring:
  • Three (3) years of post-secondary education in Business, Accounting or Finance;
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry;
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in parallel;
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate intently and work collaboratively, building strong relationships across the organization and with vendors;
  • Prior internship experience within finance or accounting would be considered a strong asset;
  • Familiarity with or exposure to accounting systems from a previous internship, especially Yardi would be considered a strong asset.

Salary

The expected base salary for this role is $52,000.


Who You Are

  • Trustworthy: You lead with trust when interacting with your team and other departments. You proactively build trust by demonstrating credibility, empathy, and sincerity.
  • Humble: Unpretentious and self-aware, you take responsibility for your mistakes. You know that egos are barriers to doing our best work and always learning.
  • Community focused: You believe what is created in community is always better than what is created in isolation and excellence is created through collaboration.

How to Apply

We value your interest in Bosa Properties. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

You belong here! If your experience and interests match with some of the above, we want you to apply. We are dedicated to building a diverse community, where everyone belongs.

Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

#Li – Hybrid
positionName: Intern, Accounts Payable (Term: May 2024 to August 2024)

description:
Who We Are 
  PAC is a leading global provider of advanced analytical instruments for laboratories and process environments in hydrocarbon processing industries. Customers choose PAC’s instruments to provide the cutting-edge technology required to maintain regulatory compliance and to improve productivity. 
  Your Role 
  The Engineering Intern assists with the mechanical and/or electrical design and testing of various company-produced systems, and the preparation of engineering drawings and documentation. Co-op from May 1 to December 31, 2024, preferably 40 hours per week. 
  Key responsibilities include: 
  
  Implement a variety of drawing changes in SolidWorks and/or Altium Designer ORCAD from markups with minimal supervision. 
  Source components, develop test procedures and conduct system tests. 
  Assist in the development and assembly of mechanical and/or electrical prototypes, and perform testing and evaluation. 
  Write up test protocols, assembly procedures and test reports. 
  Communicate with certification bodies to develop design and testing strategies and requirements. 
  
 Qualifications: 
  Education & Experience: 
 
  University student having successfully completed courses in SolidWorks and/or Altium Designer ORCAD 
  
 Knowledge & Skills: 
 
  Working knowledge of SolidWorks and/or Altium Designer ORCAD 
  Working knowledge of MS Excel spreadsheet, MS Word, and MS Outlook software 
  Ability to perform engineering calculations using mathematical and software tool 
  Fluent in English, ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals, reports and documents.
 
  
  
  Privacy 
  We are committed to the protection and promotion of your privacy. In connection with your application for employment with us at PAC, please click on this link to view our Applicant Privacy Notice. https://www.paclp.com/about-pac/careers/view

description:
Our mission is to increase the success rate of small businesses. Traditional banking has been a growth limiter rather than a growth enabler for business owners, and we’re changing that. Relay is the all-in-one, collaborative money management platform. We’re building for employer SMBs and their finance function, internal and external, and are focused on delivering a human-centric customer experience. Ultimately, we help SMBs be ‘on the money'.
 
 
 
   Relay is entering an exciting new chapter of growth. We’re looking for a Customer Experience Co-op to join one of our largest teams at Relay. This is a unique opportunity to support our growing customer base and become a product knowledge expert in all things Relay and Fintech.
 
 
 
   In this role, you will have the opportunity to communicate directly with our customers through online queries and calls and flex your writing skills by creating helpful resources for customers. You're a creative problem solver with deep empathy for helping shape the future of small businesses. You will act as the face of Relay to our customers; this is some of our most important work. If you are solution-oriented, enjoy being resourceful, and have deep empathy for customers (and like to work with a fun team!); come join us!
  
 What You’ll Be Doing:
 
   Deliver world-class customer support by answering incoming inquiries quickly, honestly, and helpfully
   Prioritize the customer experience by taking opportunities to build meaningful connections with customers that go beyond small talk (show interest in the customer and their business)
   Prioritize tasks and customer needs while working independently and autonomously
   Investigate and problem-solve together with team members from Engineering, Sales, Product, and beyond to troubleshoot customer issues and get results in a timely manner
   Develop a comprehensive knowledge base that empowers customers to troubleshoot issues and easily find answers to questions
 
  Who You Are:
 
   You have 1+ years of experience working in customer support, success, or a customer-facing role
   You have strong written and verbal communication skills, with the desire to grow and develop this further
   You have a team-first mentality and take opportunities to share learnings and learn from your fellow team members
   You have deep empathy for customers and balance being resourceful and direct with customers
   You have fine-tuned prioritization skills to maximize your impact
   You have the ability to rise to a challenge; you can handle change and uncertainty, at times
   You are naturally curious, you love to understand the “why” behind a problem or question and aren’t afraid to dig deep into problem-solving
 
 
 
   Bonus Points
 
 
   You have experience working with customer support tools or ticketing systems (Zendesk or similar)
   You have prior tech start-up experience or worked in a fast-paced environment
 
  Our Commitment To You:
 
   The expected pay range for this position is $18/hr to $20/hr. Actual pay will be determined based on several factors such as past experience and qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.
   Hybrid work environment: we love collaborating and connecting in office two times a week and offer bi-weekly catered lunches and a snack/beverage program for the days we’re in office. For the days we spend at home, you will need a dedicated and private room to conduct your work confidentially.
   Personal and professional growth: support from leaders who care about your growth and success through regular feedback and coaching. Our goal is to make Relay a step-change co-op opportunity.
   Top-tier equipment: we’ll make sure you have everything you need to produce your best work.
   Team-first culture: we’re passionate about working collaboratively, bonding through team events, and most importantly having fun.
 
  The Interview Process:
 
   Stage 1: A short writing sample about customer experience
   Stage 2: A 45-minute Google Meets video call with our Customer Experience Leads
   Stage 3: A 30-minute Google Meets video call with members of our Customer Experience team
 
  The Practicals:
 
   Reports to: Team Lead / Sr. Customer Experience Specialist
   Duration: May 6th 2024 - August 23rd 2024
   Employment type: Full-time Co-op
   Work Location: Remote. 
  Possible weekend and holiday shifts
 
 
   Research shows that women-identifying and other marginalized individuals tend to only apply when they meet 100% of the qualifications; if you don't have all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply anyway!
 
 
 
   What’s Important to Us:
 
 
   At Relay, we believe that diversity is key to building high-performing teams, and creating an inclusive work environment is our priority. We are an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome people of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
   
 
 
  
 
  We will work with applicants to provide accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. If you require accommodations during the interview process, please email your People Team contact, and we will work with you to meet your needs.
descriptionHTML:
Our mission is to increase the success rate of small businesses. Traditional banking has been a growth limiter rather than a growth enabler for business owners, and we’re changing that. Relay is the all-in-one, collaborative money management platform. We’re building for employer SMBs and their finance function, internal and external, and are focused on delivering a human-centric customer experience. Ultimately, we help SMBs be ‘on the money'.

Relay is entering an exciting new chapter of growth. We’re looking for a Customer Experience Co-op to join one of our largest teams at Relay. This is a unique opportunity to support our growing customer base and become a product knowledge expert in all things Relay and Fintech.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to communicate directly with our customers through online queries and calls and flex your writing skills by creating helpful resources for customers. You're a creative problem solver with deep empathy for helping shape the future of small businesses. You will act as the face of Relay to our customers; this is some of our most important work. If you are solution-oriented, enjoy being resourceful, and have deep empathy for customers (and like to work with a fun team!); come join us!

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Deliver world-class customer support by answering incoming inquiries quickly, honestly, and helpfully
  • Prioritize the customer experience by taking opportunities to build meaningful connections with customers that go beyond small talk (show interest in the customer and their business)
  • Prioritize tasks and customer needs while working independently and autonomously
  • Investigate and problem-solve together with team members from Engineering, Sales, Product, and beyond to troubleshoot customer issues and get results in a timely manner
  • Develop a comprehensive knowledge base that empowers customers to troubleshoot issues and easily find answers to questions

Who You Are:

  • You have 1+ years of experience working in customer support, success, or a customer-facing role
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills, with the desire to grow and develop this further
  • You have a team-first mentality and take opportunities to share learnings and learn from your fellow team members
  • You have deep empathy for customers and balance being resourceful and direct with customers
  • You have fine-tuned prioritization skills to maximize your impact
  • You have the ability to rise to a challenge; you can handle change and uncertainty, at times
  • You are naturally curious, you love to understand the “why” behind a problem or question and aren’t afraid to dig deep into problem-solving

Bonus Points
  • You have experience working with customer support tools or ticketing systems (Zendesk or similar)
  • You have prior tech start-up experience or worked in a fast-paced environment

Our Commitment To You:

  • The expected pay range for this position is $18/hr to $20/hr. Actual pay will be determined based on several factors such as past experience and qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.
  • Hybrid work environment: we love collaborating and connecting in office two times a week and offer bi-weekly catered lunches and a snack/beverage program for the days we’re in office. For the days we spend at home, you will need a dedicated and private room to conduct your work confidentially.
  • Personal and professional growth: support from leaders who care about your growth and success through regular feedback and coaching. Our goal is to make Relay a step-change co-op opportunity.
  • Top-tier equipment: we’ll make sure you have everything you need to produce your best work.
  • Team-first culture: we’re passionate about working collaboratively, bonding through team events, and most importantly having fun.

The Interview Process:

  • Stage 1: A short writing sample about customer experience
  • Stage 2: A 45-minute Google Meets video call with our Customer Experience Leads
  • Stage 3: A 30-minute Google Meets video call with members of our Customer Experience team

The Practicals:

  • Reports to: Team Lead / Sr. Customer Experience Specialist
  • Duration: May 6th 2024 - August 23rd 2024
  • Employment type: Full-time Co-op
  • Work Location: Remote.
  • Possible weekend and holiday shifts
Research shows that women-identifying and other marginalized individuals tend to only apply when they meet 100% of the qualifications; if you don't have all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply anyway!

What’s Important to Us:
At Relay, we believe that diversity is key to building high-performing teams, and creating an inclusive work environment is our priority. We are an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome people of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

We will work with applicants to provide accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. If you require accommodations during the interview process, please email your People Team contact, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:
This position will incorpo
Responsibilities:
PRIMARY:

 OutSystems Development: Take primary responsibility for developing and enhancing a collaborative project built within the OutSystems platform, ensuring high-quality application performance and user experience.

SECONDARY:

 Data Analytics & Reporting: Work on bringing all our Power BI reporting up to modern standards. This includes creating insightful, dynamic reports and dashboards that support decision-making processes.
 Code Optimization: Refactor and optimize existing Python scripts and modules to improve efficiency, readability, and performance. Ensure code is well-documented and follows best practices.
 Data Analytics & Reporting: Optimizing Power BI data flows. This includes creating insightful, dynamic reports and dashboards that support decision-making processes.
 Collaboration & Learning: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide technical solutions. Participate in learning opportunities to stay updated with the latest technologies and best practices in software development and data analytics.
 Project Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation for all projects and modifications, ensuring transparency and ease of future enhancements.

Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
 Familiarity with the OutSystems development platform or a strong willingness to learn.
 Basic understanding of data visualization tools such as Power BI.
 Experience with Python programming and an interest in developing coding skills further.
 Proficiency in Excel, including formulas, pivot tables, and ideally VBA.
 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
 Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
 Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and adapting to changing environments.

What We Offer:

 Hands-on experience with real-world projects in a supportive and collaborative environment.
 Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to impactful solutions.
 Flexible work hours and remote work options to accommodate your study schedule.
 A pathway to professional growth and potential full-time opportunities post-internship.

How to Apply:
In your cover letter, highlight your interest in technology, any previous experience with OutSystems, Power BI, Python, or Excel, and what you hope to learn during your internship.
This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to gain hands-on experience in software development. As a Software Engineer Intern, you will have the chance to work on real-world projects and contribute to the success of our team. We offer a collaborative work environment, mentorship opportunities, and the chance to expand your skills in a professional setting. If you are passionate about software engineering and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply.
Job Type: Internship / Co-opContract length: 6 months
Salary: $30.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Benefits:

 Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Education:

 Secondary School (required)

Language:

 English (required)

Ability to Commute:

 Burnaby, BC V5A 0C7 (preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

 Burnaby, BC V5A 0C7: Relocate before starting work (preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Burnaby, BC V5A 0C7

companyInfo/companyDescription:
It’s not just any career, it’s your career. As one of Canada’s largest accounting and business consulting firms, we offer thousands of opportunities to support your growth and help your talents shine through. 

MNP is a place where you can channel your ambition, achieve your best in and away from the office, and always feel proud of what sets you apart. We’re committed to delivering the supportive culture and resources you need to be successful. 

No matter your field of expertise or what you want to achieve, you can expect every day to be an exciting and stimulating adventure at MNP.
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change. 
  Make an impact with our Consulting – Economics team as a Summer Co-op/inter from May - August 2024. This diverse team of professionals understands the business needs of clients and develops innovative strategies by providing leading-edge analysis and research services. As a trusted advisor, you’ll evaluate programs and business alternatives, determine economic and financial contributions, develop public policy and empower clients to make informed strategic decisions. 
  MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices. 
  Responsibilities 
  
  Assist in the delivery of consulting engagements across all service lines and niches in the private, public, not-for-profit and Indigenous sectors 
  Execute business planning, feasibility studies, strategic planning, operational planning, program review, program re-deigns, financial analysis and other forms of management consulting 
  Assist with the development of project plans and coordinate project logistics with clients and other stakeholders 
  Identify key theoretical issues in engagements, formulating appropriate empirical strategies, understanding complex datasets and synthesizing relevant academic literature 
  Conduct detailed research and data collection, interviews, focus groups and surveys 
  Perform in-depth quantitative and qualitative analysis and consolidate results to provide meaningful conclusions and recommendations 
  Support the design and development of high-quality deliverables including proposals, engagement letters, reports, presentations and other correspondence 
  Work collaboratively with the client engagement team 
  Maintain flexibility to travel, as necessary 
  
 Skills and Experience 
  
  Working toward a Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, mathematics, finance or other related field 
  Working knowledge of quantitative economic methods 
  Experience writing reports and proposals and knowledge of program evaluation methods is preferred 
  Experience working in a consulting and/or professional services environment is considered an asset 
  Experience or training in project management and business analysis is considered an asset 
  
 MyRewards@MNP 
  With a focus on high-potential earnings, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards that support our unique culture and a balanced lifestyle to thrive at work and outside of the office. You will be rewarded with generous base pay, vacation time, 4 paid personal days, a group pension plan with 4% matching, voluntary savings products, bonus programs, flexible benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment, firm sponsored social events and more! The hourly range for this role is $22.00 -$25.00 per hour. Individual compensation is commensurate with skill set, relevant experience, and education. 
  Diversity@MNP 
  We embrace diversity as a core value and celebrate our differences. We believe each team member contributes unique gifts and amplifying their potential makes our business stronger. We encourage people with disabilities to apply!

description:
Requisition ID: R022563
   
    Job Description:
    Project Manager Internship
    Demonware (Activision), Vancouver
    May 2024
   
    Interns will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.
   
    The Company
    Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the world’s biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.
   
    We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!
   
    We’re open to work terms of 8-12 months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!
   
    Big company challenges, small company culture
    Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected users. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and interns have a huge impact on what we do.
   
    The Role
   
     Handle project management duties for smaller scale projects
     Provide up-to-date information on projects in our project management tools
   
   
     Monitor customer requests and route appropriately
     Support escalation from stakeholders when required
     Hands on assistance with resolving support requests when possible
     Assist with weekly agile rituals for engineering teams
   
   
    Requirements
   
     Highly organized, motivated, flexible and strong level of ownership
     Strong attention to detail
     Highly personable with an ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Demonware
     Excellent communication skills in English
     Passionate about organizing people, improving processes and applying an analytical mindset
   
   
     A proactive attitude, an eagerness to learn
     The ability to work well, both autonomously, and as part of a larger team
     Knowledge of agile and traditional software development methodologies
   
   
    Nice-to-haves
   
     Industry recognised Project Management certification i.e. Prince2, PMP, Agile Scrum Master training or similar.
     Prior experience with project management tools such as Jira, Monday.com or similar.
   
   
     Knowledge of the high level fundamentals of backend services and distributed systems
     Knowledge of the end-to-end software development lifecycle
     Knowledge of RESTful APIs
     Knowledge of relational databases
     Knowledge of running containerized software
     Knowledge of networking technologies
   
   
    Perks
   
     Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
     BBQs and regular fun office events
   
   
     Centrally located office
     Vacation allowance
     Competitive pay
     Free games
   
   
    How to Apply
    You can apply directly through your Coop office or directly apply at demonware.net
    If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.
   
    We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply
   
    Rewards
    We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
   
     Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
     401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
     Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
     Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
     If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.
   
   
    Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.
    The standard base pay range for this role is $49,507.50 - $104,765.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Our employees enjoy a casual work environment that offers comfort while providing superior service to our customers. We offer a comprehensive benefit package as well as other additional “Perks”!

We empower our employees to make a difference
We have an award winning culture
We offer opportunity to learn
We are financially strong and we are owned by the largest software company in Canada (CSI)
